review_body: It was clean and the staff was nice. The bed was comfortable. The location was perfect--I could walk to my business meetings each day--no cabs and no Ubers! I walked to Central Park and Times Square. Lots of good food within walking distance

Don't expect the largest rooms, but do expect clean ones coupled with outstanding service. Every morning, a full breakfast is served, and free tea and fresh coffee are available in the lobby. We didn't drink in the lounge/bar of the hotel, but we talked to others who found the atmosphere friendly and inviting. Our most pleasant experiences involved the staff: housekeeping supplied us with items we forgot or needed more of; the breakfast crew served up a pleasant good morning, and the front desk accomodated us when we forgot to check-out (because you Will sleep well) and arranged for another room at reasonable rates when we extended our stay. Thanks to all of you! Finally, if you like to city walk, this hotel is in the center of Manhattan. You are close to subway and buses (use Moovit to navigate your route). And get out and walk! The greatest way to see the city. Central park is about 3.5 miles with stops at the Met and other museums, and Greenwich is about the same with a slight detour through Times Square.

Excellent and Accomodaing. From check in to check out. I opted to stay another night and they even honored the lower price from a booking website. I've never had that happen. I will stay here again. Clean rooms. Actually, immaculate rooms.

redkisd
New York City, New York

review_body: I was skeptical as to whether or not this hotel would be fresh and clean because of the great value for the location. I was more than pleasantly surprised that it exceeded my expectations! Even my picky adult-daughter was happy! And the location was perfect for all the sights we wanted to see in NYC.My only caveat is that you could hear the clunking of the elevator in our room, which was unpleasant at night, but not terrible.

I used to live in the city and come back often. My friend and I had come for a theatre trip and we flew in on the red eye. We got in about 8am and Alam and his team got us an early check in, which was so fantastic! Yes, the rooms are small, but if you are expecting a large room you better be ready to pay a large price! For the cost, these rooms are fantastic. We were on the second floor, but you couldn't really hear the street. My friend and I travel together often and she struggles to sleep in hotels, but not here! We slept well every night. Our needs were met. I only went down to breakfast once, but it was lovely. The rooms were cleaned well, and the location was in perfect walking distance of the theatre district, Morgan Library, Bryant Park, and Herald Square. Subway around the corner. Really a wonderful place. My husband and I are going back to the city in April and our room is already booked.

First off it’s super easy to navigate too walking from Penn Station. Second it’s location is smack dab in the middle of everything. Look if you want a view go book at a hotel double in price. I used to do that, then I realized I spend 90% of my time outside of the room. So I really look for location, amenities, price, and most of cleanliness. This place had all of it. On top of it being a clean room top to bottom, they checked me in at 12:30pm. I’ve stayed at a ton of hotels in my life, I’ve never been able to check in that early. The staff was completely gracious and amazing, and even printed my concert ticket for me too. All I can say is I had three rooms I booked and cancelled up until I chose this place and I’m extremely glad I did. I saved money and stayed in a clean hotel in one of the best locations in nyc. Stay here and explore outside the room, ps there’s a Taco Bell cantina around the corner from it too, so awesome! Cheers!

Though it has a very unpretentious entryway, once inside, this hotel has very nice rooms, pleasant staff, an excellent breakfast room and a great location--I walked there with my luggage from Penn Station. Plus it's close to Macy's, all the subways, the Empire State Building, and everything I needed to be near for my stay. Definitely, a keeper!

I have just spent 9 nights at BW Premier and I have mixed feelings about it.Upon checking in, I had problems with my credit card (which worked everywhere else in the world, China included) , so I tried to pay with maestro and they do not accept it, so I asked to withhold my cash payment until I solved the issue about it the following day. The following day I was told my cash was in the bank already and could not do anything. They were able to charge me a night, and I explicitly asked to be fully charged before arriving, so I think they only wanted the cash. I was given no receipt, so I asked about it in order to get back my 200usd deposit before leaving... I must say all staff was very inexperienced, I have never had such a bad experience in the world, not even when no one spoke English.The room was large, comfortable enough, TV kept buffering though and it was very cold at night because of the poorly insulated windows.Location is good, price was 1150 usd for 9 nights which is kind of a good deal for NY, but if I knew I would have encountered these issues I would have booked at a fancier hotel.Overall this is an option if you cannot afford more (especially for being on 36th street) , but don't expect luxury of any kind.

My husband and I stayed here last week. We couldn't have asked for a better stay. I did so much research before choosing this location and was very happy with my choice. The staff was excellent. So kind, introduced themselves and gave great dinner recommendations. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated. They are normal size for New York. Our room was on the back side of the hotel, so there was not a view. But what we did have was the ability to open the window and get some fresh air. It was also surprisingly quiet when we did open the window. We only utilized the breakfast area once. It was a typical spread, but the bagels seemed to be fresh from the area. The location couldn't have been better. It was great to be around the corner from the Empire State Building, shopping, great restaurants and so much more. Times Square was easily within walking distance.

Excellent location, wonderful breakfast, employees that stay for years and are really good. The rooms are mostly small but clean, comfy and very nice.Close to 5th Ave, shopping and the Metro with lines going almost everywhere.

Booked a reservation and price dropped 30% within 24 hours - staff unwilling to reduce reservation price at all! Not a way to make customers feel good about your hotel and does not make one feel like a valued guest. Have not even arrived at hotel and already disappointed. I have been a loyal Best Western customer for some time - Best Western you can do better than this!

This hotel is a great place to spend a few days at. The staff is amazing especially Donna, Bebe, Farrah, and the rest went above and beyond for us the whole stay. Highly recommend going and the price is wonderful.
user_name:
Jason R
New York City, New York

review_body: I recently booked a 5 night stay and was thrilled with our time here. Check in was a breeze and the front desk staff was extremely helpful and courteous. The hotel located in Midtown and is smaller (17 floors) and our room was definitely small with no view (4th floor) but neither is extremely negative for me. I enjoyed that we were in a location that made walking to many locations super easy.There is a small lounge with great drink specials and amazingly friendly staff!! Thank you especially to Farrah and Sergio!! Both of you were extremely friendly!  Our breakfast was included and was an unbelievable value So much selection and Gina never let's any items go low!! Definitely a bonus having a great breakfast at I was on a business trip and busy majority of days!Overall it was a fabulous stay and would 100% book again if we return

I think the hotel is in a great location. walking distance to many shops, restaurants and public transportation in Midtown Manhattan. I've stayed at this location several times and for the most part always had a good experience. This time i found several different textures/colors of hair on the bed once i pulled the covers back. I slept in my clothes on the top cover ( i was only staying one night). The towels in the bathroom were questionable. FYI- Travel Tip #1 i always get 2 sets of fresh towels brought to my room once i check in. I slept comfortable & breakfast is usually good at this location, lots of variety to choose.

This hotel was a very good choice. We spent so long looking at where to stay for our trip to NYC having never visited before, so pleased that we decided to book here. The best feature of this place is its location, its in walking distance to Times Square, Top of The Rock and The Empire State building. We also walked to central park one day this took about half hour. FYI Bryant Park is very close and worth a visit. Food wise we ate out as this is NYC and you have so much choice from dollar pizzas to high end fine dining. The hotel does a happy hour for drinks early evening and this was worth it before going out. Breakfast at the hotel is delicious and the pancakes and maple syrup are insane. There is a little Irish Bar / Restaurant 'The Keg Room' opposite the hotel and they have basketball games and sports playing at the bar, we loved this place. Our room was a standard room and I can honestly say its the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in, although I understand this is a standard thing for NYC. Although we did have a view of the empire state building!Overall great stay and would highly recommend to family or friends looking for good value for money in a great central location.

This hotel is clean, has friendly helpful staff, a great bar and is in a great location close to stores, restaurants, and metro stations. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to stay in Midtown Manhattan. Special mention to Sergio, Donna & Bebe who made our stay memorable.

Love the location of this Best Western in NYC. YouWill be near Macy’s and other stores. Walk to Penn Station and subway station. Our room was nyc small, had a beautiful view and a great walkin shower!

One night stay. Will stay again when in NYC. Very clean. Good size room for NYC. All staff professional. Central location and easily walkable to surrounding attractions and subway and busses. Good breakfastNo complaints at all.

Super clean, convenient hotel in a great location. The outstanding feature is the great staff. Everyone from the bag check guys, the front desk, house keeping and especially the bar tender give 100%+ to make you welcome.We be back soon.

The property is in a great location. It was only a two block walk to the Empire State Building and a few blocks walk to Times Square. We stayed in room 1704 and we were able to enjoy a beautiful night view of the Empire State Building. The location of this hotel made it so easy to move around New York.

Room and hotel was very clean! 10 minute walk to NY Penn Station, 2 minute walk to the nearest subway, 10 minute walk to Times Square. The room was on the smaller side but all you do is sleep there! Would stay there again!

Perfect amenities in a comfortable hotel in a great location - midtown NYC. I wish I brought my pet dog with me for the weekend. We will definitely stay there again. Had a fantastic time; even though it was a short weekend We loved every minute of it & Best Western made it a 5 stars experience.

This hotel is in a prime location in NYC. There is a parking garage on the same block and many restaurants and services nearby. You are close to Macy’s, Times Square, Madison Avenue, and multiple subway stations. It’s in a great neighborhood and I never felt unsafe, at any time of the day. The room was small, but clean and comfortable and quiet. My travel companions were very tall, so the bed was small for them, but I slept very well in the double bed. I would definitely stay here again!

Terrific midtown location of this hotel is just one of the many pluses. The front desk personnel could not have been nicer and more helpful—great representation for BW. The room was spotless and well appointed with coffee and tea available as well as access to a breakfast room and lounge. The art work throughout the hotel was spot on and NY centric. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a welcoming and comfortable stay.

ParisienneNJ
New York City, New York

review_body: I’m very satisfied during my stay in your hotel nice sleep very close in my need in the city, I’m enjoyed during my stay I will be back again in your hotel also I bring my families my friends my co workers

The service staff was amazing. The breakfast was tasty. Everything in the hotel was clean. My room had a great view. The room was not as big, but that's standard in New York. You can't beat the location right in the middle of the city.

The accommodations, the location and the staff are all great.We stay here whenever we are in town. Clean, comfortable with a good hot breakfast and nice happy hour.Shukla runs a great variety of breakfast food.Sergio in the bar is personable and a wonderful bartender with a welcome to everyone!

I spent 11 nights here, no negative points.Since I checked-in everything went smooth and perfect, Jenny and Donna at the front desk made everything possible to help and made me (and other guests) feels like home. During all my stay the cleaning was done impeccable and all the employees of the hotel talk to you smiling and asking if you need anything to improve your stay.Regarding the location, it couldn’t be better. Exit the hotel to the right, 5th Avenue, to the left? 6th Avenue and Broadway, it’s better located than many other (and much more expensive) hotels I’ve stayed.Without any doubt this will be my hotel for the next visit.Congrats Team!

Great central location, Midtown, to use as a jumping off point to explore Manhattan. The big Macy's and a Metro stop are only a block away. Very friendly staff, clean place. They provide earplugs on the nightstand! but we never had to use them, even on a lower floor. Decent breakfast that while it's not included anymore is still a decent price.

I spend 4 night in this centrally located Hotel. The room was clean, the Breakfast was sumptuous, the Coffee in particularly wonderful. The staff were helpful especially Donna , though each one of them went out of their way. It is centrally located to the subway and the financial district. Is a good value for money. Will consider this hotel on my next visit as well.

Great location and value to stay in the city. Walking distance to most everything. Rooms are small, but all you need to stay in the city. Staff was very accommodating. Very clean rooms! Highly recommend for a weekend away in the city!!

Was here for a Business trip. The location is great! Lounge is very small and noisey. Hotel elevators are very noisey. Room very clean which is one of the most important things. The staff is very friendly and helpful too.

Plus points: warm hospitality of the staff, very strategic location to all main attractions, great ideas to relax at the chairs on street provided by the hotel, modern amenities in the room.Negative points: nothing significant. We are all happy with this hotel and want to stay there in the near future.

The rooms are nice, clean, cozy, small but comfortable and the service is good. The problem is that the lobby is very small so you don't feel like you are entering a hotel. The entrance area is not that nice as other hotels but once you enter your room it is ok. Good experience overall.

My family and i had the most awesome stay at the hotel. Everything was up to standard, my view from my room was really amazing. Breakfast was great staff welcoming us and friendly as we entered. Ayam was just amazing always smiling and eager to assist. A big thumbs up to Donna at reception, she was so helpful and always smiling and friendly. The last night of our stay she made reservations for a cab to collect us to take us to the airport, and the day of our departure when she realized that the cabs are running late she called again to inquire. Big thank you to you Donna.

Just arrived at the hotel and couldn’t get the tv to work so I called the front desk. Ayman arrived and fixed the problem literally in five minutes. Awesome service, pleasant staff. Very nice room Great location.

Great hotel located in the heart of NYC! Friendly staff and great bar with awesome wine and beer prices. Cute decor and a boutique sized hotel! Great value, even though there was not a complimentary breakfast like all the other Best Western properties we have stayed, but it is NYC! We will be back for sure!!

Spent the night at the BW Premier Herald Square for a last minute holiday trip before returning to work. It was absolutely wonderful. Bebe at the front desk was very helpful at check-in, provided detailed local transit information for me and inquired how I was doing during the course of my stay. Donna and the other gentlemen at the front desk were also all very pleasant and helpful. Great rate on the room, which was on the small side as is typical in New York City, but spotless and very comfortable. I don't drink much, but the happy hour offer at the hotel bar was too good to pass up. Farah the bartender was very welcoming and made me feel at home. Hotel is in a great location, convenient to Madison Square Garden, Amtrak, the Javits Center, Broadway, mass transit and many good restaurants.

Baltimore, Maryland, United States

review_body: This hotel went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed and cared for during our trip to NYC for the holidays. The front desk crew had wonderful suggestions for dining out and the lounge bartender was a wonderful host at the end of our evenings. This hotel was positioned perfectly for all the things we wanted to go and do. It was easy to get a cab or uber or walk a few blocks to see the sites! We would return to this hotel the next time we are in town for sure!

cincinnati, United States

review_body: A perfect hotel in the middle of everything in Manhattan. A 3 minute walk to Macys says it all. Clean rooms. We like the included breakfast, its a good start of the day not having to go out and look for something to eat. Friendly staff, like Ayman and Ryan for instance. We highly recommend this hotel and will def come back

Nice hotel in a nice and convenient location. The rooms were quite adequate for what we needed and we had no complaints. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. I think that they went above of what is required. This was not just to me but everyone that I saw them help.

We absolutely loved our recent stay at this hotel! So happy we listened to all the great reviews & booked this hotel! Location was perfect - very close to many major attractions & restaurants, 3 minute walk to Macy's, 10 minute walk to Times Square & the subway. Room was perfectly clean, comfortable, & just the right size for our family. All front desk staff were very friendly & helpful. The complimentary breakfast was an absolute delight! Ayman & his staff graciously provided a hot, delicious, breakfast with a variety of items each day, served on real plates & coffee mugs! We had not planned to eat breakfast at the hotel each morning, but we happily did! The food was delicious & the very professional staff worked so hard to make it special for guests. Thank you! We just loved it! Our family felt safe going & coming from the hotel. We used the parking garage close to the hotel, just down the street, to store our vehicle during our stay, and had no issues there either. We would absolutely stay at this wonderful hotel again in the future!! Thank you for an amazing NYC stay!

Honestly I was surprised how amazing this hotel turned out to be. Friendly staff all around and great location in New York. It was my first time in New York and my sister and her husband stayed in the Hyatt next to us and I may be bias but I think Best Western was better for the price we paid. Everything was clean and bed was so comfortable. Thanks for all you do, Best Western Premier Herald Square.

Excellent hotel!!!! Perfect breakfast, all the staffs are kind and nice! Room very clean and comfortable! If I visit New York again, I’ll choose this hotel certainly! The location is great too, near the train station and bus.

I was impressed at the quality of service and how quickly our needs were met. Rooms are on the smaller side with modern bathrooms. Staff is friendly and professional. The location is central and the room rate is reasonable for NY. I plan on staying there again. Thank you for a wonderful experience!

We got everything we asked for really fast no matter what. Ayman who works at the hotel is super nice, just like everyone else we spoke to. We stayed at the hotel during New Years and the personal we’re able to hook us up with some awesome last minute choices for dinner and everything. Overall just a perfect example of a great hotel!Ps. Tell Ayman we said hi! // The Twins

This is a nice, reasonably priced (for NYC) hotel in the perfect location for sightseeing. We were 3 adults, one needing a handicapped accessible room. The person who made the reservation said she couldn't guarantee rooms next to each other, but added it as a special request. When checking in we found that, not only were the rooms next to each other, but they were in the back of the hotel on the 12th floor. This meant that it was quieter and afforded a perfect view of the top of the Empire State building! The rooms were small but made good use of the space and they were immaculate. We would definitely stay here again.

I have chosen this hotel after comparing many hotels. This is a family reunion trip which I would like to make sure the group of the family has an enjoyable holiday. Indeed, the hotel room is s bit small but the location, complimentary daily breakfast and most importantly the staffs, particular Ayman make it all up as compared with other hotels. The breakfast area is a bit small but staffs are working efficiently to make sure people won't have to wait for long or you can go earlier. There are enough variety for everyone and at least I can see they change one of the hot item during my stayed.As other reviewers mentioned, I have seen Ayman work in breaskfast area in the morning, I have also seen him helping on storing luggages for other customers and I have even seen him at night responding to room service request. All staffs are friendly to customer which make this hotel outstanding. I have no reservation to recommend anyone who plan to stay there.

Convenient location with easy walking access to many NYC sites.Clean rooms. Nice complementary hot breakfast. Helpful staff. Was able to store bags at the hotel prior to check-in time.I especially want to recognize Ayman, a member of the hotel staff. Ayman checked our bags early in the day, then retrieved them for us late in the evening when we returned to the hotel. He also worked seating guests and clearing tables at breakfast the next morning (when does he sleep?). He was friendly, courteous and helpful at all times.

Every single thing about this hotel is great. The staff, the location, the breakfast, the checkin/out. The location is especially great and I would stay in this area again. Just on the outskirts (a couple of blocks only) of the real tourist crowds but close enough to walk everywhere. Easy walk to Broadway plays. BE WARNED the rooms are tee-nienny. That means very small. The smallest room (Europe included) I have ever stayed in. The room/bathroom is nice and its everything was wonderfully clean but TINY. If you need some space this room isn't for you. Otherwise it was a great stay.

Our stay was lovely first class service breakfast excellent foodroom very comfortable.location in access to everywhere.Beverages available 24/7Robert was lovely & helped us alot a credit to the hotel.

Very close to subway. Comfortable and a very clean room. Great breakfast. Friendly staff. Ayman the breakfast host was so friendly and accommodating. Will come back for sure. Thanks for everything....

The staff here is really nice and the location of the hotel is excellent! It's a short walk to times square and The Empire State Building. Definitely recommend if you are looking for a nice hotel in NYC.

Stayed 4 nights here and the location is great plus the staff are super friendly. Robert Bebe at reception is super friendly and helpful. Rooms are big and hotel is good. Breakfast not the best but it’s inclusive so it’s a good deal.

Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: This is a gem in the middle of the city yet the room was quiet. Stayed for one night for a weekend break and our stay was so convenient as everywhere is in walking distance. Front desk staff was so helpful. Breakfast was complimentary and Ayman was so friendly who really made a difference. Thanks for making our days in NYC.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Cleanliness is very important to us and this hotel exceeds our expectations. The staff at check in and check out are very helpful. Ryan checked our bags and then brought them to our car. He is an asset to this hotel, very kind and helpful. We have stayed here for several years and will continue to come back.

on 36th street in Midtown. Price was very reasonable for midtown Manhattan. Everything was excellent, check-in, room and breakfast. Room was a little on the small side but was very clean and the shower was great. I would definitely stay there again.

We had a great stay here! Staff was super helpful, friendly and accommodating. The hotel is great, it really is in the heart of everything. It's steps away from Time Square, Empire State, 30 Rock, Herald Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue, the subway and much much more! It's clean/modern and has everything a hotel should have. We really enjoyed our stay and would absolutely recommend it. It's a pretty cool feeling waking up in downtown Manhattan

Our room was a good size, bathroom too, although not much time is spent in the room it was clean and the bed was made and towels replenished each day. Bed was very comfortable too. Breakfast was varied , fruit, pastries, eggs, bacon or sausage, toast, etc, the staff here really keep the tables cleaned and the food replenished. Location of the hotel was brilliant, walking distance to most sites and very near the subway too. In the reception there are tea and coffee machines for a takeaway drink. We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it it.

Imagine, wanting to see the Big Apple, wishing you could afford to stay right in the heart of Manhattan. 2 minute walks to all the New York sites to see. A hop, no skip to transportation to every borough. And the most comfortable bed when the day is done. Breakfast in the morning after, and delicious entrees for future lunches and dinners.Well, imagine no more. Reality presents, Best Western Herald Square.So, book and enjoy. Save that money for some great New York theatre. Be sure to pick up your recommendations from the hotel knowledgeable staff.

We stayed for three nights in December. The staff was very helpful, the room was modern and clean and the continental breakfast was perfect! Great location too! Walking distance to several great restaurants.

The hotel even provided ear plugs to help sleep in a noisy city that doesn't stop working in the night.We would definitely stay here again. The hotel is not a large, lavish one, but it provided us a comfortable stay in a large city.

We stayed here for 4 nights in December and had a lovely time.There were 3 adults and our room had 2 beds, room was on the small side, but we never felt it was too small. Not much room for luggage but there were enough room 2 normal size bags.Bathroom had a shower with ok water pressure. Everything was clean and worked. Our room faced the alley so we had no noise issues, not from the street or from the neighbors.Breakfast room is tiny, so that might be an issue, we always found a table, so cannot complain. Breakfast selection was good (bacon, eggs, waffles, yogurt, juices, muffins etc).Staff was efficient, check-in and check-out was a breeze. Only minor complaint is the housekeeping, the actual cleaning was very good, but like so many has said before, it is done very late, so when you come back to your room at 4PM, your room might not be done yet.The location of the hotel is excellent, walking distance to MSG, Times Square, Grand Central etc..Recommended!

We booked a twin bed sharing room in this hotel for 3 nights. The location is very accessible just a short walk from Macy's Main store, Empire state building and times square.Staff were generally friendly and accommodating, Welcome drinks served upon arrival. Lobby is small but well laid out and well lit. Hot water and juice available near the elevator.Upon reaching our room which is situated at the 11th floor, it is neat but a bit snug for 4 persons. Bed is comfortable and no unpleasant smell in the room. The Toilet and bath is small as well but clean, soap and shampoo were provided as complimentary. We avail breakfast for 4 and it is acceptable and nothing really special. Breakfast is located in C floor, just a tip to be there early as the dining room is small with limited capacity.Overall it was a pleasant stay and budget friendly as well. Hotel is recommended for tourist

This hotel is a bargain for Midtown. It is clean, the bedding was great and it was convenient. Don't let your bias about the Best Western brand negatively influence your decision to stay here. My peers stayed at a nearby "big brand" hotel and were not nearly as satisfied with their experience as I was with mine.

The staff, hotel facilities, pricing and location were perfect. Nothing was too much trouble. If you want to be close to the action and also quieter during sleep hours the BWP at Herald Square is the place to be.

Just returned from a few days in New York. We stayed at the Best Western Premier and cannot rate it highly enough. the reception staff were very helpful and extremely pleasant nothing was too much trouble. The Ayman and his staff in the breakfast area, are so helpful and the breakfast set us up for the day, hot and varied choices, an added bonus to this hotel, breakfast area kept clean and tidy.The rooms we had a beautiful king size bed which was divine, both my husband and I had great sleeps on all the days we were there and so did my son and his partner, the bathroom was good with a lovely walk in shower, towels changed every day, toiletries supplied which was nice, even though we did not need to use them. Room was cleaned every day.This hotel is set in a great location, to most of the sites, especially handy when you have been shopping in Macy’s and can quickly get back to the hotel to dump your bags and then go out and start again.I thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone who is thinking of going to New York, if I ever go back again I will definitely be booking the Best Western again.Another added bonus they have a very nice bar with once again pleasant staff.A big thank you to all the staff at the Best Western for making our stay a very enjoyable one.

This Best Western was conveniently located in Herald Square, between 5th and 6th Avenues. There is a subway station nearby, but it's was not an exceptionally long walk to Rockefeller Center or Times Square. It is in a commercial area, so it can get a bit noisy, but the hotel provided ear plugs, which we did not use, so the noise was manageable. We enjoyed our stay and appreciated the location. The rooms are compact, but clean and the bathroom was updated and clean. Our room did not have a bathtub, but the shower was a comfortable size.

My 2nd stay at this hotel, and very good experience again. I travel to NY every 3-4 weeks so I've seen a lot of different hotels. This one has become one of my favorites. Excellent location, smaller rooms but very clean, nice and cozy, comfortable beds. Also great service and fantastic breakfast. If I could make one suggestion - I'd ask to add a small speaker to the room to hook up an ipod so to have music. Everything else is great. Thank you, I'll definitely stay there again!

We were looking for a nicely priced hotel close to parade and Broadway. This is the perfect location. Close to great restaurants and shopping as well. Starbucks on corner. They offer drink coupons and breakfast but we did not use this.

This hotel is tucked in but stands out in terms of service and quality. Room was a bit small but fine for two of us.The shower was hot and full pressured. Comfortable bed and breakfast was great. We were able to walk right out to Herald Square for the parade and shopping.

It was a great location, near Bryant Park, Penn station and not far from times Square. The hotel was not so good. The first clue - ear plugs on the bed - and yes they are needed!!! When the neighbors talked in their rooms, flushed their toilet or had a baby who cried, it sounded like they were right next to you. Only one of the elevators worked, and there was a line for breakfast each morning. The cleaning was not until 3-4 in the afternoon and they did not understand English. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Stayed at mid-November for three days on business trip. Very good experience. The only area where service must improve is Disabled's needs. Especially in dinning area. Had a good value for the cost of stay.

If you travel to NY this hotel one of best options price and location. Clean. Good breakfast .near subway and many Manhattan attractions. No refrigerator in the room. Easy to reach from Lagsrdia airport

This hotel is right in the middle of everything...walking distance to lots of sights! The rooms are cute, and I recommend a room at the front....view is a real treat of the city!Staff was extremely polite, helpful. Bebe and Jay at the front desk went the extra mile to accommodate our stay at the BW, Ryan showed us to our room and made sure to answer all our questions! It was our first time in NY city, and would recommend this hotel! Breakfast included...very convenient start to the day! Coffee and cold ice water available 24 hrs in lobby!

Just back from 3 nights at Best Western Herald Square. Great place to stay. Clean, comfortable and an amazing location. Very safe with lots of great shopping and places to eat. When we arrived Ryan stored our luggage and then brought it to us once we checked in, along with a fridge we requested. He was so friendly and efficient. Gave us the same 5 star treatment on our last day when we needed to store luggage again. This hotel serves a complimentary breakfast which was a great way to start your day. The food was hot, tasted good and lots of it. Ayman, in the dining room, keeps the place running smoothly by quickly clearing tables and seating guests. The room is small and busy but Ayman runs the place well and was always so friendly. The bar has happy hour from 4pm to 9pm. It is small but the atmosphere was great. After a long day shopping and exploring NYC it was like being home when, Sergio, the bar manager greeted you and you could sit and relax. Sip your wine and listen to great music. Sergio was so friendly, efficient and made you feel right at home. He gave great advice on places to shop and eat. The bar is busy but you know its a great place to hang out when its packed with locals and not just hotel guests. We really enjoyed our stay here and will definitely return

perfect stay. Very convenient location, I was here to see a show at the hammerstein ballroom. We were able to walk to the venue as well as Bryant park and time square. The staff was very friendly and professional. The rooms were spotless and comfy.

We were very pleased with this BW. Clean, comfortable, nice breakfast, and lovely employees. We had an issue with the room thermostat, and it was handled immediately. We would certainly feel more than comfortable staying here again.

Great hotel, great location, staff very good, Donna on reception very good and helpful, great bar in hotel too. Hope to return soon. Central to bars, restaurants, Madison square gardens. Empire State building.

Hotel has an excellent location and the staff is always friendly and helpful. I can't remember staying at a place that had such a good staff. I've stayed there twice and plan to return. The breakfast is very good too. Very well run hotel.

We stayed three nights at this hotel. The rooms are very clean and have everything needed for your stay. The rooms are very small though. Breakfast is just ok, we stuck with a bagel or oatmeal. The location is wonderful, easy access to Times Square and subway. Jay was great and made us feel welcome at check in.

The young lady that checked us in (I hate it when I don't remember their name) was so pleasant and helpful with our check in and questions we had about getting around. We came in early and were able to check in. We had some questions about the subway and she gave us the stop we needed. Very knowledgeable about the area.

Close to shopping and theater in the city. A nice location for activities in the city and transportation. Close to eateries also. We got a voucher from the front desk for 2 for one drinks at the bar. When we went to the bar, we were told it was only during happy hour...not stated on the voucher.

If you want spacious luxury, look elsewhere. But if you want a conveniently located nicely kept place to stay while exploring Manhattan, this is your place.Near to the theatre district, surrounded by good restaurants, handy for shopping (Macy's!) and staffed by extraordinarily friendly and helpful people, we loved our stay. From Oct 28-Nov 4th 2019 we enjoyed everything about the hotel. Particularly noteable were Sergio, the bartender in the lounge, who added greatly to our trip, and Ayman, traffic director, table attendant and really helpful guy in the dining area at breakfast.Complete with a patio attached to the lounge and a sitting area in front of the hotel to watch the street traffic go by, we were pleased and satisfied with every aspect of the hotel.

Breakfast was really busy and we had to wait to get a seat, but Ayman, the server was THE BEST! Friendly, fast, efficient, helpful! Singlehandedly, he managed our seatings, cleared the table, made small talk. A Superman!

We visited NYC again and chose to stay at Best Western bec of its great location right in the middle of the city , walking distance to Penn Station, Time Sq, 5th Ave, etc etc.A very special shout out to AYMAN , the breakfast ambassador who singlehandedly quickly and cheerfully, cleaned out the tables , managed the crowds and organised the seating for the line of eagerly awaiting patrons daily ! We marveled at his cool headed nature each day. And by the afternoon, we would find him working in the left baggage dept ! He's friendly, efficient and must say ,the best employee and ambassador for BW hotel ! Well done !

Just as last year we enjoyed our stay here very much. Make sure you book an executive room and enjoy the beautiful view. Worth to mention is also the good breakfast variety and great service of Ayman! Well done, thank you :-)

Donna at the front desk was lovely! I didn’t stay here, but I used BWP’s Luggage Hero bag drop service while in the city for the day ($1/hour, $8/day max). Very kind, friendly and professional — I will be using this location again.

We were impressed with the layout of the rooms and friendliness of the staff. In particular, we were very impressed with Ayman at breakfast our first morning at the hotel. Great location close to many subways and NJ transit

Very good location in center Manhattan Nice, kind, helpful staff especially Donna, we really appreciate her kindness and attention during our stay We really enjoy our vacation in New York We will be back for sure

Good hotel in a good location that is walkable to restaurants, Empire State Building, Times Square, and subway stations - including Penn Station. Nicely decorated room and hotel lobby make this hotel a cut above the typical Best Western. I enjoyed the Halloween decorations!

My stay here was absolutely amazing. The location is very close to a lot of attractions. I have to say, Aymon was very organized and he made sure everyone get in and out of the breakfast area. That’s probably my favorite part of the stay. I will def stay here again!

We really liked the breakfast and especially the outstanding Service of the staff member Ayman!! The orange juice was also pretty good, we hope that the bacon is going to be available tomorrow again. We will visit the Hotel again soon

My wife and I stayed here for three nights and could not have been more pleased. The hotel is perfectly placed for all the Manhattan sights, two blocks from the ESB, ten minutes walk from Broadway and Times Square, a little further to Grand central stn and the Rockefeller Center and the top of the rock. Penn stn is again about a ten minute walk and you can get numerous subways just around the corner. The rooms here are small but perfectly formed, spotlessly clean and have everything you need for a comfortable stay. The staff are also very friendly and helpful and are always there to give advice or show you the best way to somewhere. We had a really nice room on the 17th floor(which is the top floor) and had great views of the ESB. There is a cosy court yard at the rear of the hotel again with great staff and very responsible prices if you fancy a wine or a beer. We would not hesitate to stay here again or to recommend to anyone.

The best western hotel in herald square was a great place to stay for the money. It is located near lots of great attractions and restaurants. There were many items to choose from for the breakfast that is included in the price. .

We stayed 2 nights before a cruise and found this property to be typical of compact NYC hotels with first rate amenities. Love the front patio area while waiting for transportation and the full breakfast was great and waitstaff was attentive. The front desk was helpful, courteous and pleasant to work with for restaurant recommendations and luggage storage for our half day before the cruise departure.

location of this place is outstanding. Close to the subway, close to restaurants. a family of four was comfortable in the room. For being in midtown rooms were good. That this hotel was absolutely outstanding. We had an issue with our air conditioning, and within seconds the maintenance was knocking on our door ready to help. this was approximately 8:30 p.m. in the evening on a Saturday. When in the city we will definitely stay here again.

Lovely place, with a strategic location between the 5th and 6th Av., but, above all, kind and lovely staff, seriously commited to make you feel at home at all times. I would return there undoubtedly in my next visit. Thanks and regards to all of them.

Stayed for 4 days on Columbus Day weekend. The location at 5th Ave and W 36th St is simply awesome. It allowed us to walk to so many places - we didn't take a single taxi all weekend. The room was nice and clean and comfortable. The size and price of the room are reasonable by New York standards. The breakfast buffet offered a good selection of foods. We will definitely stay there again!

Muhid gave great courteous service to my wife and I at breakfast this morning - nice place to stay, great location. I never leave reviews but this gentleman stood out. Hopefully this is now 200 characters long!

This location was great. 2 blocks from the Empire State building and the stop for our hop on hop off bus. The rooms were small, but comfy. The breakfast outstanding. The kitchen staff and dining room staff kept hot food trays full and tables clean and ready. Muhid, the host, was very nice too. The front desk staff were very pleasant ...and that makes happy visitors. Thanks to the staff at the Best Western premier at Harold Square NY.We'll be back I'm sure!

Staff very nice, room comfortable and clean. The best thing of all was the complimentary Breakfast!! The Best I ever had at a hotel. I spoke to a gentleman who worked there -Muhid and passed on my compliment.

This hotel was well located for Times Square, Empire State Building and the Broadway theater district. Also close to subway stations. Main problem is that rooms are very small including bathroom. No shelf space to place your things including bathroom. My wife and I were constantly bumping into each other. I have had bigger cabins on cruise ships.

We spent 5days in this Hotel and it was just a great experience.Very professionell and friendly staff …@frontdesk @bar @roomservice, each single Person in this Hotel working btw 5th and 10th Oktober was so nice! Thank you we enjoyed it so much! Greetings from guests room 1404 :)

Almost everything about this place is ideal. The location is right in the middle of Manhattan within walking distance of the Empire State Building and the theater district. The staff is friendly, helpful and welcoming. They have a bar on site that allows you to bring in food and they offer a happy hour. They even gave us a buy one get one free drink card. The room is small but has everything you need- a desk, 3 drawer dresser, a small closet, bedside tables with a drawer. The room is quiet. Breakfast is extensive with two kinds of eggs, sausage, hot and cold cereals, bagels, toast, fruit juices, muffins. The one thing I would change is the king bed length. A normal king bed is at least 78 inches. I am not sure if part of the issue was that part of the bed was under the headboard but my 6 foot husbands feet hung over the bed when he slept. Overall a highly recommended experience at a reasonable price.One tip- many of the “New York City” hotels are not in Manhattan as NYC has 5 boroughs. Check locations carefully before you reserve.

Very friendly staff. Excellent location as I was so close to K-town and all of the shopping Herald Square had to offer. Very clean room. I slept well in my room. It was nice of the staff to literally give me a room right next to the elevators as I usually prefer. They had free breakfast down on the C-level. Lots of choices to choose from such as eggs, bacon, pancakes, and waffles. You can also have hot coffee and tea. By the way, do visit the hotel bar for its very excellent priced drinks during happy hour and do remember the hotel is located in mid-town Manhattan. Say hi to Farrah, the bartender for she is so nice, helpful, and friendly. Do remember to bring your BOGO voucher for the drinks. Lastly, if you are a Best Western member, you can also get an additional 250 points if you spend at least $20 at the bar. Do tip Farrah nicely for she deserves it. As a Best Western diamond member, I was recognized by the front desk and I did get a bag of goodies. They also had a function to request for amenities and it was sent up to your room within 30 minutes without charge. This is something I expected from five star hotels such as Hyatt and Hilton. So, for Best Western to do that is something I appreciated. On a side note, they also gave you extra requested amenities, so that was nice and generous.Yet, one let down amongst everything else being so good was the $25 gift card voucher. I did submit the gift card printout to the front desk prior to check in and it has been almost two weeks already, but it was not deducted from my total charges. I hope Best Western customer service will reply soon to my email in regards to that issue. Also, I hope all Best Western brands would consider having slippers for their guests as a much appreciated amenity. Other than those two issues, I was very impressed with this BW Premier Hotel. Thanks.

Pros: Good location, very near to the Empire state building, UN headquarters. Rooms are clean and friendly receptions.Cons: poor air conditioning, no free water bottle, need to get cold water from a jar near the reception, long queue at the small breakfast room with unfriendly staff staring at you when you choose to take food to eat in room.

This hotel is amazing! The staff are incredible and nice, the room was immaculate and the free breakfast was outstanding. The hotel room was so quiet even though it was a busy weekend. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

The best place to stay in New York City. Donna, Farah, and Rachael provide an environment that makes you feel like you are among friends. The breakfast is excellent and provides a great way to start a day in New Your City. The rooms are average size for NYC, the beds are great, and most importantly the house keeping is the very best. The hotel is located centrally. The people make this the very best hotel in New Youk City. We travel throughout the United States and the Best Western at Herald Square is simply the best. Please do yourself a favor and enjoy New York City by staying at this establishment.

Needed a place to crash for just one night and due to the reviews and prices, I booked here. I got in late, and the front desk checked me in in less than 2 minutes. Quick, nice and efficient! My room was small, but faced a quiet alley (which I had requested); it was clean and the bed was comfortable. Shower was hot and had good pressure. Breakfast offered lots of choices - eggs, sausage, oatmeal, French toast, breads, yogurt, whole fruit, cereals, pastries. Nothing was delicious, but options were good. Worked out in the minimal gym - treadmill didn't work, and there were only weights, no mats or balls or bosu, so I guess not many people use this. Wish that a hotel could figure out how to make a quiet door - I kept getting woken up by a teenager going in and out of her room and her parents' room. Special thanks to the staff - from the front desk, to the bellman, to the breakfast staff. All polite and professional.

I was really looking forward to our stay at Great Western. Having stayed with a couple of bigger chains in New York, I hoped from other reviews that this smaller hotel would have more of a personal touch. We were not disappointed.  It’s location is great, round the corner to Macys and Empire State Building, ten minute walk to Madison Square Garden and Times Square district. The staff were very welcoming on our arrival. Check in was very smooth. We were allocated a room on the 6th floor and told about hotel amenities. The rooms aren’t as big as some we’ve been in, but they are well designed, lovely comfortable large bed, plenty of tea and coffee replenished each day, and lovely toiletries.The complementary breakfast was very good. For us there was more than enough choice. The dining room has limited capacity, but even at its busiest we didn’t have to wait for long for a table. We used the hotel bar, lovely staff in there, and the happy hour is very good value with good quality drinks. The biggest thing I want to acknowledge and thank the reception staff and house keeping staff for, involves my husband and my reusable Starbucks cups. We brought our inexpensive reusable Starbucks travel cups along to use to purchase coffees, and also use instead of disposable cups for the complementary (good quality) drinks in reception. On our last day, I realised the cups were missing, we had used them each day up until then. I reported this to reception who not only investigated as promised, but initiated the lady in charge of housekeeping to actually go out and purchase us lovely Starbucks travel cups as a replacement. She acknowledged she had spoken to the lady who had done our housekeeping, who had mistakenly thrown them out, believing we didn’t want them anymore. Thank you for your excellent service, your courtesy- and also to all staff concerned for your honesty. It was brave of the lady to admit her mistake. Fabulous stay, and you really went the extra mile. We can’t wait to visit gain x

My wife booked us here for my 40th birthday. We had been in NY in January and stayed up on Park Avenue. This hotel was so much better.The receptionist that greeted us on arrival was extremely pleasant and efficient. Took 5 mins to check in.The room was standard small for NY but how much time do you spend in your room??? The room itself was spotlessly clean, fresh towels everyday if you want, tv, coffee maker. Really good!The hotel serves breakfast hot and cold buffet. Bacon, scrambled eggs, sausages, coffee, bagels...... rarely did we need to eat again till dinner time.The bar has a good buzz around it, especially happy hour.Location is perfect.Definitely come back!

Stayed here for a week in August. Couple with our teenage son. Great location near Empire State Building, Bryant park and Herald Square. Easy walking to subway as well. Rooms are nice but tiny. Typical for NYC. Breakfast was very good. It was busy but the wait was never very long. Wifi worked great. Room was always cleaned. And overall the hotel is very good. Can be noisy facing the street but the AC drowns out the noise. The hotel should ban smoking on the patio (like the hotel next door does) as we couldn’t use it since it always had smokers puffing away on it. Would recommend and we would stay here again.

Excellent location within easy walking distance to many "Must See Sites". Great free breakfast with a wide variety of choices. We stayed on the 16th floor and there was no traffic noise. Very helpful, friendly staff. Excellent Happy Hour in the bar to finish off the evening. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to other tourists who want an excellent location and other amenities.

Having stayed in this hotel all of the staff are amazing and the hotel is very well run and nothing is too much trouble.The rooms are very spacious the location is very central maing it a very good base to walk to all of New Yorks attractions

Stayed during September 2019.Hotel is well located near the subway and Herald square. Times Square is a 10 minute walk away. Room had a view of empire state building. Excellent variety and quality of breakfast. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Rooms have a coffee maker, bar fridge and lobby also has a beverage station. There are Delicatessens located around the block for quick snacks and fresh meals. Will definitely stay again!Excellent value for money in NYC!!

Everything from the check in to the hot breakfast was excellent at this hotel. The location is also very convenient as you can walk to Times Square, Top of the Rock Empire State Building and other attractions.

The staff was very helpful, the front desk friendly, good breakfast, the room very clean, I had a very good experience and I recommend this hotel,it's very good localization near the subway station, the good famous stores, so if I returned to NYC certainly I'll go to repeat the hotel,thanks for the good time that I stayed there Giselle Schuhli Maffessoni

Property is in a great location to sights and subway. Front desk staff VERY helpful, it was our first time in NYC. Nice little lounge with outdoor area and nice nightly drink specials and good bartender. Nice little waiting area in front with chairs/tables.

NYC with 14 of your best friends! Perfect location~one of the best trips ever! Surprised the hubby with tickets to Billy Joel at Madison Square Garden and 6 other couples joined us on the adventure. This hotel was recommended by friends who have stayed here before~they were 100% on point. The front desk handled the 14 of us checking in with no problems, laughing, joking, making us feel right at home. All of the rooms were not ready yet, but we did arrive early before the listed check in time and they accommodated us the best they could. Lobby was clean, small but it is NYC and there were 14 of us ( and we are not a shy quiet crowd). Our King size bed room was perfect for the two of us~clean, laid out well, good size shower-great big window - can’t think of anything else that someone would need-it was perfect. The breakfast buffet was great, it was what I expected and to be included in the rate was another perfect! Location, location, location-subway nearby, couple of nice bars near by, middle of the action- this hotel location checked off all of our wishes and needs! Parking garage was nearby- good rate, safe and easy to get to. The front desk answered questions, all of the staff were very accommodating, the lounge and drinks were great! Sitting out front watching the world go by was perfect. Can’t say enough good things about this hotel! We did all of the tourist things, 9/11; Empire State Building; the concert; Times Square; Little Italy; China town; Chelsea Market; St Patrick’s cathedral; Battery park; Central Park....went to the oldest bar, oldest pizzeria and oldest steakhouse - we loved every minute and can’t wait to go back. We will stay here again-no doubt in my mind, It’s Perfect!!!!!!!

First time visitors to New York. Not sure what to expect. Found the location of this hotel just perfect. Close to subways, Empire State Building , fifth avenue. Macy’s, Times Square. The hotel is spotless, reasonably priced, daily maid service , good breakfast, helpful staff, WiFi, would come again.

The location was great and close to all the sites in midtown Manhatten. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Our two bed unit room was narrow but clean and adequate. We enjoyed our stay and would return.

Muhld at breakfast was exceptionally hospitable. He got us a table right away and made sure we had great hot coffee. We had a good start to our first day in New York City and felt ready to go to the Metropolitan Art Museum and later the Frick Collection.

My favorable impression of the hotel is similar to the other positive reviews I had read prior to booking. Great location for shopping, quick walks to the Metro, Times Square, and of course the Empire State building. Gracious, professional staff were always available to provide assistance. Luggage storage was available prior to check in and after checkout.Breakfast room is very small and generally crowded unless you get there very early. Even if you have a wait, it does move quite quickly. They offer a variety of foods like: an egg entree, a meat choice, breads, pastry, whole fruit, yogurt, cereal, coffee/tea, and juices. Keep in mind that it’s a small hotel set up of food and by no means gourmet otherwise you’ll be disappointed. I enjoy a cooked to order breakfast personally, but chose to eat here daily since it was ample and included in the room rate.Very small gym with the basics. It along with all areas of the hotel were always very clean. Small bar area offering daily specials and area to sit outside. Small guest rooms, which are typical in NYC, but are well appointed and clean. Overall a good value for our stay. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay again or recommend to others.

Worked out perfect. Subways close, plenty of food places close by and always helpful if had questions. Breakfast was good always crowded but kept it well stocked with different stuff everyday. Bar is small but really friendly bartenders.

We stayed at BWP Herald Square for 4 nights just prior to our cruise with Royal Caribbean. Walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building, and Big Bus Tours stop. Ryan and Donna were very helpful. Keens Steakhouse (a 5 star restaurant) is just a few doors away. Really enjoyed our stay!

The location is great. Close to everything yet not too crowded.The hotel facility and especially the rooms are new and in good shape. Windows are sealed and rooms are quiet.The staff is very welcoming and accomodate all needs.Bar is nice and bartenders are very welcoming. I sat there to eat on my arrival at 10pm on a rainy night and it was great.There is a breakfast at the hotel which I found it very rich with variety of options to have.The hotel was great and I think it is suitable for both families and business tourists.

Stayed here October half tern with our children 10 and 12. Stayed for 5 nights. The hotel is very clean, room was nice although not a great view but hey its NYC. Hotel is in a great location to get around, right by the Empire State building. Breakfast was included in our stay and it was very good with a good selection. Staff ok, bit miserable. Overall a good stay.

Room was clean, well stocked. The breakfast staff (Muhid in particular) were WONDERFUL! The tables were cleaned immediately, the food was fresh and constantly refilled - even tho we got there closer to the end of breakfast time. The nighttime clerk could take some pointers from the “breakfast crew”. She was not very pleasant and got annoyed when I asked for her to clarify her pointing in general directions ie:”the breakfast is on level C- over there”. Overall I would stay again

Between 5th and 6th street and one block from the Empire State Building this hotel is close to it all. Approximately six rooms per floor, every employee greeted us not only on check-in but every day we were there. Four blocks from Penn Station, 7 blocks from Times Square, 2 blocks from 2 major subway stations. We walked to Times Square nightly. Every night we sat in the small front patio area reminiscing the days events. There are numerous places to eat within the block.

My mom and I had a wonderstful stay at the BW Premier Herald Square. The highlight of our vacation was Farrah working the hotel bar. She was very hospitable! The hotel was a great location, rooms were clean, breakfast was perfect and the front desk staff was also very helpful.

Hotel was very clean, quiet and great central location in Manhattan. Rooms are small but enough. Bed was very comfortable. We were given early check-in which was great after our long flight. Breakfast was included - average continental breakfast. Staff was very friendly.

Great breakfast. Perfect location. Elevator oké. Nice staff, great organisation. Helpful, rooms not really big, but oké. Clean rooms, perfect for two, three difficult. Fitness room oké. Price for NY very affordable.

Our room was clean with comfortable beds and relatively quiet (10th floor). Hotel is in a great location - close to subway and short walk to Times Square. Breakfast every morning was a little different from the day before - hot and cold items - something for everyone. Ayman and the rest of the staff were absolutely terrific!

You will go back here if you visit. The rooms are clean and welcoming. You save because you are provided with a large buffet for breakfast each morning, and you are not served the same thing, you enjoy a variety of foodstuff. The dining room is not large but the setup allows you to eat your family and conversate.

Good position in Manhattan. The room are clean and well equipped. The staff is really kind. The American breakfast is good and the bad is very comfortable. In case of gluten free need they provide a snack for breakfast

We really enjoyed our stay here. Great location for subway, Penn Stn and Empire State only 2 roads down! Rooms were ample size, cleanliness was second to none with lovely maid service. The breakfast had good ample choice and happy staff. The reception staff helped in locating a lost Kindle and kindly sent it on to us! Thank you! We’d stay again!

We arrived well before check in. They found us a room which was totally unexpected. The location is fantastic. The staff helpful and polite. Sergio at the bar: you are kind and a gentleman. Great place to stay.

After a flight from the UK we arrived at JFK at 16:40. We took the Airtrain and the LIRR to travel to Penn Station. Even with 2 suitcases it was fairly easy and only cost $25.50 (Airtrain & LIRR) for 2 of us. After finding our way out of Penn Station it was about a 10 minute walk up 7th Avenue and then along W 36th Street to the hotel and arrived approx 19:00.Location of the hotel could not have been better. Several restaurants/bars on the same street and only a few minutes walk from Herald Square Subway. All staff in the hotel were welcoming, friendly and did a fantastic job. Our room was well maintained, quiet, comfortable and very clean, we even had a view of the Empire State Building. The breakfast area in the basement did get busy at times but we always found a table. There was enough choice at breakfast that should suit everyone. The bar was nice to have a drink in after a busy day and on a sunny day it was nice to sit with a drink at the front of the hotel.We would without hesitation recommend the hotel and would probably choose to stay there again if we returned to New York.

Stayed here for 5 nights. Just off 5th Ave and about a 3 min walk to local subway station - great location. Was a little loud at night but hotel give earplugs so that was perfect. Great bars across the road and the bar staff were both lovely (guy and a girl - were both very helpful with recommendations). Majid and the breakfast chefs were all lovely (another lady and another Egyptian guy). All the staff were all so helpful and lovely - unfortunately cannot remember all their names! Good value for what you get. Would definitely consider coming back here for my next visit to NYC.FYI - get breakfast included because it was great value for money)

Nice one night stay in at Best Western Premier on last minute decision to book a room in the city. Was able to get a good rate especially for midtown on a week night. Room was clean and staff was friendly - easy to check in. Room isn't that big but good enough for 2 beds. Earplugs included given there was construction going on- nice of them to include with a note. Was able to sleep without issue.Free wifi included. Breakfast is included as part of the stay in the AM or get a breakfast to go bag (forgot about this) instead of rushing to have to leave for work. would definitely stay here again. Photos in the dining area are all NYC themed - definitely nice feel. complimentary coffee/tea in the lobby - though water for tea taste like coffee (shouldn't mix containers). Being a Best Western rewards member is good to get points for every stay and with my level, got welcome bottle of water and snack bar. would definitely stay here again.

New York City, New York

review_body: Clean, comfortable hotel that is a bit of an oasis in a very busy area of NYC. Generally we like to stay in the Upper West Side or the West Village - or quieter places, but choose this Best Western because of the rate and because I have had good experiences at other Best Western Premier Hotels. We weren't disappointed. The staff are very helpful and pleasant and seem sincerely interested in creating a good experience for guests. Our room was nice with a great urban view. Would've been helpful to have a small fridge but we got by.

The hotel is clean, modern and rooms are reasonable size for NYC. There is a complimentary breakfast, not ample, but reasonable. Hotel is located within a short walking distance from Bryant park, Times Square and the Empire State Building. Herald Square sub station is just behind a corner and Penn station only few blocks further. It's very convenient location to see the sights by walking or by subway.You can hear the noise from the street and hallway, but it was not bothering us at night. Housekeeping forgot to replace some towels few times, but otherwise everything is very well.

I stayed for a week in this hotel and was great the experience. The employees so friendly and helpful. The room was clean, nice bed, clean bathroom with products. Near Empire State Building and metro station. You can walk to Times Square like 25 min. and enjoy the streets. Nice location, no so near, no so far. Nice basic breakfast.

Amazing location, excellent breakfast services, front desk and bellhop service is very courteous and helpful. I will definitely be choosing this establishment on my next visit. Walking distance to all your favourite spots. Walked and crossed Brooklyn bridge and took water taxi back to 34th so many nearby places.

This hotel is quite centrally located. It' s about a block from the Empire State building. The room I had wasn't huge but it was comfortable and well-appointed. The staff were all really helpful and the bartender (whose name I unfortunately have forgotten) was a real gem. Happy Hour was really welcome after spending the whole day walking around Manhattan. After walking 30 km in one day, a cleansing ale or five is just what you need and the bar is quite pleasant. There's a great laundry just across the road which did a fairly big load of my washing for $14. The same load in London cost me 37 pounds sterling! There is also a great restaurant, the Kegroom, just about 50 yards up the road where you can get a great feed for not too much money. In short, this hotel is an ideal place to rest your weary head, leave your baggage behind and get out and explore New York with gusto. I'll definitely stay here when I return.

Location is very convenient and the service is great! The rooms are comfortable and the service does a great job of cleaning. The desk clerks are very kind and greet you upon leaving and entering. Ayman of the breakfast service is a great worker and is welcoming.

One night stay,elevators you can wait forever. Doors slamming to the point of waking people up. They have a back patio and bar area. When we went in after our show the bartender made it very clear he was about to close,FORCED TO LEAVE. Next morning breakfast would have been included except the line was so long to get in most people were giving up, as we did.

review_body: It’s has been one of my best property till date to stay And will look forward to stay regularlyThe staff is awesome and really helpful.Specially I would like you to say that Mr Evgene in Best western premier NY herald square has been up to the mark on the front desk Good skills...keep it up

I was charged $1,043.22 and I did not even stay at the hotel. I tried calling the hotel several times but was always put on hold and no one ever returned. I reached out to BW customer care and was told, "cannot process any refund for your reservation as it was booked with a a non-refundable rate" but yet I could cancel for free till June 5th and after $899.97.BW can check there records On June 1st I cancelled ALL hotel reservation that I made with them. STAY AWAY, STAY AWAY bad business!

Recently stayed here with my teenage daughter for four nights and enjoyed our stay. We stayed in room 806 which is at the back of the hotel so was very quiet at night for a great sleep. The free breakfast is good with hot and cold items which were different each day. The breakfast room is quite small but we only had to wait for a table once and it was only for a couple of minutes. Our room was also quite small but big enough and it was modern with a big comfy bed and nice shower. There is also a nice bar area at the back where you can sit outside and have a drink. The location is good, walking distance to most things and with a subway very close by if needed (34th Street Herald Square). I have nothing negative to say about this hotel and recommend it.

Family room not very large but adequate and very clean, beds were really comfortable and bathroom seemed recently refurbished. The staff at this hotel were great - friendly, welcoming and helpful. The included breakfast was fine but breakfast room gets busy so best to get there by 8am. The little courtyard attached to the bar was a nice space for drinks especially during 'happy hour' which I think was 4pm till 9pm. Close to subways and bus routes. Would stay in this hotel again.

Great hotel in midtown Manhattan. Steps to Macy's and subway. Breakfast sufficient to start the day. Ayman at breakfast was friendly and helpful.Rooms were a bit on the small side but clean. Also a bit noisy if on the road side, but I guess that is to be expected when you are in the Big Apple.

Great stay especially if you are looking to go shopping. Close to transportation, mall, shops, restaurant food and attraction.The hotel is very nice and clean. Rooms have everything you need to make your stay comfortable and Convenient.
