review_body: Mist hitel rooms in Manhattan are small...so if there are some that complain about that....you will get the same at mist hotels. This hotel is well located to wakk to most places un Manhattan ( Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park...and even Square Union and Soho if you like to walk). Breakfast is good (thougjt dining area is small so if you don't like to wait go early), most the workers are nice and helpful and rooms are comfortable.

Our family had a great time in New York, New York and our stay at the Best Western was great ! The rooms were clean and the breakfast (which was included) was also great. Ayman, one of the servers / caterers at the lounge was very friendly and helpful and made us feel at home.Definitely recommend this place to family and friends and come back again.

The location is in walking distance of time square, Central Park, Chrysler Building, Empire State which is around the corner, and of so many fine eateries in the city. The hotel has 6 small rooms per floor and 17 floors. The rooms are small but very nice and well maintained. It was the perfect room for 2 people. We were on the 6th floor and the room was very quiet even for being in the middle of the city. The small gym and breakfast is in the basement and the breakfast was plentiful and tasteful. The lobby/main floor has a bar/lounge in the back that was very nice. This hotel and a very much worth it stay if your in the city. If you have a larger family traveling you may want to entertain more than one room but other than that, a perfect, clean, quiet stay that was perfectly located in Manhatten. The price was also very friendly for a NY stay.

Our family had just returned from Italy and we were really craving an "American" breakfast. Ayman, Shukla and Debbie ensured we were welcomed and had everything we needed. The breakfast area was stocked well, the food was hot, everything was clean and the seating was comfortable.

I came in this hotel with my family. We had a nice breakfast this morning with Muhid. He was very kind and gentle. It was a real pleasure being treated like that after the wake up! Now we’re ready for the big apple!!

This hotel was nicely located in close proximity to a Subway station (1 block away) or walking distance to 5th Avenue. It made traveling around New York easy. The have a nice continental breakfast in the mornings and fresh cold water all day long in the lobby. The cold water in the lobby was nice because it allowed us to refill our water bottles after long trips through the city. There is a nice bar/lounge on the first floor.

Here is one bar trick that you should absolutely watch out for in the hotels bar. One of the bartenders has tricks he uses to cheat customers.I was an easy target for the bartender to rip me off. My husband ordered a beer, approximately 4.50 dollars, and I paid with my credit card. On the receipt I got to sign, it did say 20 dollars and I didn’t understand why. Instead of asking, I thought it was some kind of suggested tip, and that I was supposed to write the amount I wanted to pay. There were line for tip and a line for total. So on the line for total I wrote the amount I wanted to pay. I wanted to make sure I did right and asked the bartender but he just dismissed me. The whole thing ended up with me paying the beer over 25 dollars. When I later that night went back to ask the bartender why he charged me so much for the drink, he was very rude, asking me why I would sign a 20 dollar receipt for a beer, he had ‘all’ the receipts except for mine etc. Of course I made the mistake of not questioning why he charged me 20$, trusting the hotel’s bartender, also not asking for my own copy of the receipt. However the main issue here is that the bartender had the intention to rip me off which I think is so sad. I hope he had a good time with that extra tip. As far as I am concerned, I learned a lesson. And in my opinion, he ripped me off.Furthermore I informed the staff at the reception who promised to look this up, but no body from the hotel cared to get back to me.

The Best Western Herald Square is the best kept secret in NYC - crazy cheap prices and excellent service - and very clean rooms and new furniture and seating areas. Ryan Karikar is amazing bellman! Ryan was very attentive to my needs (like bringing me an umbrella during a sudden downpour, letting me access my luggage before I needed it to get to the airport) - there are many outstanding employees at the Best Western Premier Herald Square - Ryan is at the top of the list!

The hotel is well located and has comfortable accommodation. But the best is the service of the staff (restaurant, cleaning and reception). Highlight for Salman and Rachel, who were helpful from our arrival until our return.

Generally the breakfast staff were excellent. One moorming, Muhid, working very much alone, showed an exemplary attitude to his work; work reallywell under pressure and arranged the overcrowded dining room so very very well. Congratulations ot him.

First of all, I have 4 criteria when booking a hotel: good location, good price, clean, and safe. Guess what - this fit all four. The location is great, and the subway station is close-by. We were on the 10th floor, and our room was not only quiet, it was immaculate. The breakfast was very good, and though the selection was changed up every day, I wouldn't have complained if I could have indulged in their waffles every morning! The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, as was Ayman the go-to guy who seemed to be there when anything needed to be done, and it was always done with a smile. Oh yeah, I would definitely stay here again!

The hotel is in an excellent location, near everything. Having breakfast was good and set us up for the day. The happy hour was great! The staff are lovely, really friendly and helpful. The staff in the restaurant work so hard as can get very busy. Ayman and Muhid especially! We stayed a week and there were 4 of us, could have done with a bigger room. we coped, would definitely recommend this hotel.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a night before leaving NYC. The hotel was very full, but the staff were super helpful and efficient. The breakfast was more than we expected, and Aiman did a great job getting everyone seated and turning tables quickly. This hotel is a great budget option for NYC - I don’t normally write reviews, but the hard work and great service from the staff was particularly noteworthy.

First day of check in Eugene was great we drove from Virginia for six hours and he helped a lot we got a view to the Empire State Building and Ayman in food area as well very nice guy will be coming back here again

All the people who worked in this hotel were very helpful and were very diligent in their jobs!! Ryan and Muheed were very sweet! Uhm ya now i’m just filling out da rest to get to that 200 minimum yeee

We came to thos hotel from VA and came a day ahead of our reservation unbeknownst to us. The 800# scheduled us o. The wrong day. the hotel staff was very understanding and made sure we could stay that night without having to find another place to stay. They didn't have to do that. We were. Very thankful!

Superior hotel in Garment District. Just ask for a refrigerator, of course small rooms - it's NYC! , located near restaurants and delis all on same street, walk to flagship Macy's or many other spots, Uber comes in 1 minute or cabs too, Full breakfast free. Good internet. Even has a lounge. Looking forward to our next trip to NY as this will be our home.

Lovely hotel with nice clean rooms & really friendly staff. Breakfast had nice selection & Ayman was always there with a big smile waiting to help you. Fantastic location right in the middle of Manhattan where you're only a 5 minute walk from Macy's & 10 minute walk from Times Square. Would definitely recommend anyone to stay here if they're visiting New York.

Clean room, breakfast good variety, location is close. 5 minute walk to times square. 20 minute walk to Central Park. On busy street so a good night's sleep after sightseeing was out of the question. Upon check out I went to grab a bagged breakfast because I wasn't going to have time eat breakfast at the hotel due to early flight. Clerk told me that I could not get one because they were for guest who missed breakfast. ?? Any who, stay was okay

This hotel situated in the city-centre of NY is one of the few hotels in NY that offer breakfast,and it is ideal for a city trip!! The personell is friendly and helpful, especially eager to make your breakfast experience a nice one!! I have stayed here twice, but never had a room with a view. If you have a light sleep you might hear noises at night (Bybs-cry) and the sound (and beeping) of the lift. But the for where it is situated you can hardly ask for more value for money!!!

We have stayed here twice now, and received the same great service each time, and the complimentary breakfasts are incredible. Different items every day and all good. Arman checked on us to make sure we had everything we needed. He and all the breakfast staff were fast and friendly. Would stay here again.

The staff and building were great! 10 minute walk to Times Square and 30 minute walk to 90% of the attractions we participated in the city. Clean room, good breakfast and great layout. Only inconvenience was that there was no fridge in the hotel room which would have made things better for our trip. poor sleep quality only because our room could not be kept cold to sleep. Street facing wall was all window and the A/C couldn't be set below 67.

There was a loud clanking the whole week I stayed at this hotel. The sound was like someone hammering in floor boards. Turns out to be the elevator that clanks anytime someone uses. This noise went on my whole stay. I reported it to staff every day of the week and all they said was "oh we are calling the repairman" or "we know it's going to get fixed" A good sign should have been when I walked in the hotel room to find a pair of earplugs. I also advised the cleaning ladies twice that the towels although not used smelled very strongly of a musty scent. I will never stay here again.

I might be biased because I loved New York and everything about it including this hotel. It’s not the flashiest hotel but it’s comfortable, clean and tidy. The staff are pleasant. The breakfast room is tiny but the food is good and the staff are lovely. The hotel is in a great location, it was a 2 minute walk to the subway, Macy’s is around the corner everything I wanted to do was easily accessible. It felt like my own New York appartment.

Great location, close to everything - empire state building, shops, penn station. Very good breakfast choices, good room size. Very helpful staff, especially the food crew Muhid and Ayman. Will stay here again.

Great hotel! The location is perfect for being centrally located to major attractions in NYC. The rooms are clean and quiet, the breakfast is excellent, and the staff is helpful and friendly. If I ever come to NYC again I'll stay here!

This hotel is very nice clean and has everything we needed. On the first day of was pouring so the girl at the front desk Rachel put my and my sister's sweaters in the dryer when we asked, also the lady in the breakfast part got us dairy free milk and non meat sausages it was so amazing of them they went above and beyond! I would definitely stay here again

Room was clean, bed comfy, desk staff was very kind and helpful. Muhid did a great job at breakfast each morning. Food was good and he was very prompt removing plates and cleaning up. Thank you so much Muhid

Clean and nice hotel with all amenities . Breakfast was amazing and staff were helpful . Special thanks to Ayman ,Jay and Rachael for wonderful hospitality.Location is in the city and near to Empire State Building , restaurants and Pubs

I booked at the last minute in Manhattan. I won’t make that mistake again. However, I was very satisfied with my Best Western Herald Square choice. Great location. Smooth checkin and checkout. The rooms are small like many in NYC but tastefully decorated and a delightful place to come “home” to after a day walking the streets of NYC. Attention to detail is important to me so I appreciated the earplugs though I didn’t need them and the amenities provided and/or available. And...i know this is weird but I loved the fresh caulking in the bathroom. Felt clean and healthy. I had breakfast the first morning but decided to pass the second. Usual fare, clean but cool scrambled eggs don’t appeal. Easy access to all kinds of transportation with a staff who are actually eager to be helpful. Thank you Best Western for an excellent hotel experience.

We enjoyed our stay here while we were on our vacation. Rooms are a bit small, but I hear that is typical for New York and actually once you are in bed, what more room do you need? Breakfast is fairly same at all BW properties, but we really enjoyed specially made small size (just right) mini Danish rolls, Almond Crescent rolls, etc. Very Delightful!!! Thanks for adding that to our NY visit!!

Quality at a reasonable price. And the location is perfect for anything you want to do/see. The entire staff was wonderful...front desk, cleaning staff, breakfast staff....everyone. We flew red eye from California and arrived at hotel at 8am. The stored our luggage and invited us to have breakfast before we hit the town. Such a great start to our trip! We were given a 15th floor room with a view of the Empire State Building. Quiet room...slept so well! Rooms are tiny but we knew that before our trip and from past ny experience...but who hangs out in the hotel while staying in Manhattan? We were allowed a late (12:30) checkout which made our morning so much less complicated than it might have been.

He was very kind and hospitable. He gave us a table as soon as we areived and can clean many tables swiftly as there is only a limited space alloted in the breakfast area. He was very accomodating and polite

This was our second stay at this great hotel. Our room this time was on the very top floor and a bit smaller than our last room but was still every bit as comfortable and welcoming. The staff were just as friendly and professional as our last visit. I love this hotel as it’s so central to all the major tourist attractions...

Excellent price for New York. Friendly and helpful staff especially Sergio in the bar. He made our happy hour very enjoyable. Rooms are very small but I guess normal for city standard. Excellent delicious breakfast and very good location as you can walk to many attractions.

I work a few blocks away and sometimes just need a drink after work. Sergio is the ultimate bartender! In this crazy city you don't often find someone who remembers your name, your drink and makes you feel like you are the only customer that exists! It is evident that the entire crowd(which is handled with ease and expertise)is having a better day because of him! What a wonderful attitude, cheerful, kind and simply the best! I am grateful to have this place to stop in at the end of the day! If the rest of the staff is like this the hotel will be in business forever! Farrah at the desk was super nice as well! Happy hour rocks!❤

review_body: A great hotel, the rooms and nice bathrooms. Sergio, in the bar, was ever helpful and cheerful. I recommend the excellent self-service breakfast which was varied throughout our stay. The hotel is a mere 4 minute walk from the Subway station at Herald Square - so ideal for gadding about. Fabulous value!!

Hotel is conveniently located and has nice clean rooms, spacious lobby. Free breakfast offered a lot of options. A special note about Ayman our server from breakfast - one of the hardest working hotel employees I've seen.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Best Western Herald Square. First the front desk was very accommodating, the rooms were clean and comfortable (small, but hey - it’s New York! ) and the location was very convenient. The next morning at the delicious free breakfast Ayman was particularly attentive in making sure we had everything we wanted, and the chef even came out to discuss a peanut allergy and cook up something to satisfy. We felt very valued and would certainly recommend!

Good Hotel and location. Great staff very helpful. Debbie the breakfast chef, made sure breakfast went well, even though it was so busy!!Ayman got us a table and made sure we were comfortable.Enjoyed our stay

The hotel is in a good location walking distance to Times Square. the rooms were clean with the basic amenities, the best part was the staff everyone was friendly Ayman, and Debbie during breakfast we’re amazing and went over and beyond.

We stayed here overnight prior to our cruise. A great location to get around to see the sites; either walking or take the subway. We arrived way early to check in time. They had our room ready within an hour. There is a luggage room to store your bags in the meantime. The fellow that took care of the bags & brought them to our room was also very polite smiley & willing to do whatever it takes to keep guests happy. The reviews I read said the rooms were small. There is plenty of room to get around one another; this is not an issue. There are small details within the hotel & amenities to appreciate (too many to name). The beds are decent & the rooms are very clean & modern. Other than a few doors opening & closing around around bedtime, noise was not an issue. BREAKFAST was delicious & not your typical continental. We arrived prior to the “6:30am” open time however Aymun was cordial & permitted us to go in & eat. Debbie arrives at 430am to make the REAL scrambled eggs & quiche. There is another young fellow working down there. We met him the day before; he said come early because the line will go out into the hallway. There is a fair amount of seating; you can bring your food up to your room. Beside toasting up your bread or bagel everything else is hot & ready to eat. Great price, clean hotel, very friendly & accommodating staff. We would definitely stay here again & recommend for your stay. We were pleased with everything!

We stayed here exactly 1 year ago for my son's graduation. This time I returned with my father as he's been going on about getting back to visit my son since we left a year ago. The service and facilities are just as good as then. Bebe was still at the front desk and got us checked in quickly and professionally as before. This time we got some drinks from the on-premise bar during happy hour. Prices were in line with other establishments in the area.Breakfast was just as crowded as before. Here I do have to commend one employee for helping us out -- Mihud. My father is in a wheelchair now and Mihud went out of his way to get the handicapped table cleared quickly for us and helped my father get his chair to the table. When we were done he also cleared our used dishes quickly so we could sit a minute and finish our coffee.Overall, the facilities are in good condition and clean, the staff is efficient and friendly and the price is a good value. The location is convenient for a lot of the touristy things to do and there are plenty of excellent restaurants within a few blocks. Definitely worth your consideration for your next trip to New York.

Our room was clean and a great view of the ESB, the service and hosts were helpful and kind. The breakfast area was always clean and the food was fresh. The attendants, especially Muhid were helpful and attentive to all guests.

Stayed here four nights for daughters graduation and vacation. Hotel is central to everything with a subway only 1 block away. Empire state building was 1 block over and could be seen from hotel room window. Free breakfast was a great value. Only negative was the clunking sound of the elevator as it moved between floors. Hotel only has a few rooms on each floor so no way to get a room far from elevator.

I stay at this facility fairly regularly for business. Customer service here is incredible. As always Ryan went out of his way to be helpful.Desk staff also great.The hot breakfast is pretty good here as well. Both Ayman and Muhid helped to make the breakfast enjoyable.

Location is excellent, a block from Herald Square with easy access to public transportation. Room was clean and comfortable. Bed was comfortable. All amenities (internet, TV, hair dryer) worked. The bathroom was clean. The staff were superb!! Friendly, efficient, they went out of their way to meet all our needs. Breakfast food and staff were excellent. We will stay there again.

I stayed at the hotel in a short visit to NYCPrice was decent, while hotel is very nice, and so was the breakfast. Location is great, and the rooms are fairly new and renovated. Breakfast was American typical and rich. You should attend it early since the dining room is a bit small. Recommended.

Everyone was really warm welcoming and helpfull. The breakfast is all we need for a big day walking down manhattan. The hotel is perfectly located really close to times square, the empire state building, broadway and all of nyc. We had a really nice stay over there.

Room: the room was a little small but since there's so much to see in the city and you spend not so much time in the room, it's ok. Bed and bedding were good. Shower was awesome with and with a shower box instead of a bath tub, what I like!Breakfast: breakfast is included in the price, what is good. You will find 3 or 4 varying hot options (sausages, scrambled eggs, etc), a variety of salty and sweet breads, some bagels, butter, jams, some muffins, yoghurt, cereals, orange juice, coffee and water.I must specially mention a guy who was organizing the tables for breakfast every morning: Ayman. Even though guests were kind of crazy to get a table, he was very kind and patient all the time to organize everything. Great service from him!Location: the location was perfect for us! You have everything at a 3 minutes walking distance. There are 2 good pubs and 2 good restaurants 20 meters away from the hotel. There's a Subway station 2 blocks away at 34th street.Considering it all, I think the cost benefit relation of staying there is really good. I would stay again for sure.

One thing I must say about this hotel. The staff great and very helpful. The rooms were very clean and updated. If you need a parking garage. Just two minute walk from the hotel. Also the hotel is in a perfect location for, dining, tourism and shopping. I would definitely stay here again.

Spent 6 nights and found the hotel to be excellent. Front desk staff helpful (even offered to lend me her personal umbrella). Peehaps the hotel will invest in some for their guests! Best was Sergio in the bar. He offered great suggestions on places to visit after we thought we'd visited every major attraction. Would we stay here again? YES!

The room itself is smallish yet spatious enough for two person. Cleaning has been done thoroughly. No noise from the streets but louder voices from the corridor can be heard through door. Breakfast is free with various food to choose from and the breakfast room serves well. All the breakfast waiters/waitresses have been really nice, especially Ayman rocks. Location is excellent, just a few minutes from nearest subway and for example Macy’s and Empire State Building are within short distance.

Great time and excellent breakfast Ayman he is great guy help everyone to enjoy breakfast Thank you ayman for your help and you number 1 here so happy with your service and we love Newyork and people in Newyork

Our stay in NYC was wonderful!The staff at this hotel were incredibly helpful and knowledgable.The hotel is in a great location in the city and made it easy to get around.My wife and I loved the complimentary breakfast but most of all we loved the view of the Empire State Building from our bedroom window!We will definitely stay again the next time we are in NYC.

This hotel is very well located for a NYC trip. It’s only a few blocks from the main attractions of the “big apple”. Only 2 blocks away from Macy’s. One block from a subway station. Room is quite small but this is the reality of all the city and you won’t find anything bigger for this price. Best thing is it has breakfast included in the price.

Great location. The staff was very friendly and attentive, with Muhid at the breakfast area being exceptionally helpful. Speaking of which, having free breakfast (from 6:30 to 9:30) was fantastic, being able to quickly get nourished and get on with exploring NYC.

A great find ! Clean, friendly and convenient. It had a much nicer breakfast than we had expected with an excellent attendant staff. One chap named Muhid made sure each morning that we wanted for nothing. We would happily stay there again.

The hotel is very well located and the staff is nice, especially during breakfast Ayman was very attentive and nice. The hotel is close to thé main touristic places in midtown (empire state, rockfeller, times square). I recommend!

First time in NY and after long long way we came in this great hotel with very helpfull staff, started with great receptionists who was very helpfull also with booking problem with creditcard and Ray who help with luggage and next morning suprised us very friendly and helpful Ayman at breakfast, which was great first morning in NY. Looking forward for next daysTHANK YOU

.This rating is based on service, complimentary breakfast, and location as I shopped around before deciding on this hotel. My criteria is reasonably priced, good location, clean, good service, complimentary breakfast, fitness center.Pros:Convenient location in Manhattan CleanFriendly and efficient serviceComplimentary breakfast with hot and cold foodsFree newspaper in the lobbyFree Wi-FiComplimentary coffee, tea and infused water in the lobbyCozy bar in the back Hot shower which feels good after a long dayCons:Small rooms - tight quarters just for sleepingBasic fitness roomWalls are thinI shopped around for a hotel that was clean, had a good location, reasonably priced and if possible, have complimentary breakfast and Best Western Premier Herald Square fit the bill. I know in New York, especially in Manhattan it is difficult to find a reasonable price for a stay and usually the best deals are directly on the hotel websites. I am a gym rat and I knew there was a fitness room and hoped that I could get a good work-out there.When my friends and I arrived, we were met with friendly front desk and they put us in rooms right next to each other which is great! I loved most of the amenities: free wi-fi, complimentary coffee, tea and infused water all day in the lobby, coupon for buy one drink, get one free in the bar. The rooms were small but clean.I noticed on the first day that the light in the doorway flickered out and left a note for housekeeping and when we returned that same day, the light was fixed! The second day, we were tired from walking and sightseeing and came back to the room to rest but after about 20 minutes, we heard a loud noise and it was apparent that a maintenance crew was doing some repairs in the room two doors from us and it sounded like they were in our room as they were shouting and talking loudly. So much for our naps but they did not realize anyone was in the rooms on our floor. The second day we came home around 5 from a long day out and wanted to rest and we found that housekeeping was just finishing up cleaning our room so we had to wait in our friends' room next door until she finished cleaning up our room. We thought it was a bit late but I guess it was a busy day for housekeeping.In trying out the fitness room, it is located on the lower level near the dining room and it has the basic equipment along with wet wipes, towels and water. There are no mats for stretching or extra props like stability or bosu balls. Of course the room only fits 3 machines: cycling, treadmill and elliptical and free weights. So you can get a basic workout there. We also checked out the cozy bar in the back and it has two big screens to watch sports which we did one night and we used our buy one get one free drink coupon. It was inviting and the bartender didn't rush us out at closing as the basketball playoffs had gone overtime for 5 minutes, and she let us watch until the end.As far as the complimentary buffet breakfast goes, it is well worth the stay but a heads up is get there before 8 am as it gets crowded between 8 and 9 am (hours are 6:30 to 9:30 am). Service is quick, friendly and efficient and the staff are attentive, and welcome you and point you to an available table and clean up tables quickly so turnover is fast. There is a variety of food available, fresh fruit, juices, hot and cold cereal, hot foods like bacon or sausages, scrambled eggs, omelettes, waffles, a toaster to heat up your bagels or toast, pastries, yogurt, coffee and tea so you have much to choose from. The location is good and easy to walk to Times Square, catch a subway or catch a tour on Big Bus or any of the other tour buses. We found that Times Square and Broadway can be very congested with people and cars and we ended up walking to and from the theatre district due to the congestion of cars. We did take Uber and Lyft during our stay and it wasn't a problem getting to our hotel. I got alot of walking during this trip and that is part of my exercise routine. We stayed here for 5 nights and I would return as it is a solid 4 star.

Excellent hotel. Clean, friendly and the staff very helpful. The location is convenient for subways and close to shopping area. Excellent breakfast and Muhid every morning made sure we were well looked after. Highly recommend

We’re staying at this hotel for 7 Nights and today we had breakfast for the First Time. There’s plenty of things in the breakfast buffet(sweet and salto) and Muhid , the waiter, was really nice! He worked fast and made sure we didn't have to Wait long for our table.

We had a good time at this hotel. The location is great Just arround the corner of 5th avenue. The room was nice and clean and the breakfast was really good. Muhid the breakfast attendant was really helpfull.

Muhid in the kitchen is so great, incredibly helpful. I stay in this hotel every time I'm in NYC because they don't charge a "facilities fee".The location is also very central and convenient. 10/10 will totally stay here again.

Stayed again...love this hotel as the staff and location are great. Sergio in the bar make a mean whiskey sour. Always stay here when in NYC. Am never disappointed. Clean, efficient, rooms. Quick walk to Macy's and Empire State Building...and, outdoor patio to imbibe and enjoy good weather

It was a very nice stay in this hotel. Especially Ayman and the guy from the bar were very friendly.The hotel is close to the Time Square, the Rockefeller Center and the Empire State Building. The rooms are small but very clean an comfortabel.We come back again for sure.

The staff were so friendly and helpful. Ayman at breakfast, the barman and the receptionist all couldn’t do enough for you! Ideal location, our room overlooked the Empire State Building! Would recommend

I'm staying this week. Can anyone tell me if there are gluten free options on the breakfast? How comfortable are the double beds? Is the toilet, sink and shin one room or separate with sink and dressing area outside the toilet and shower?

This is a wonderful, peaceful retreat in the middle of my favorite city in the world. The location is great -so close to subway stops. The rooms are clean and in great condition. Robert in reception is wonderful.

Stayed at the Best Western for 4 nights and the location was good, about a 10 minute walk to times square with lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. The rooms are really small the breakfast is average but you get what you pay for. The hotel is nothing special but it was clean, quiet and convenient

I find Robert and Rachel at the reception very friendly. The room is modern and clean.Through our window at 10th floor we could see the top most point of the Empire State Building and at night when lighted it looks romantic. Best Western is very accessible to popular places like the Bryant Park, Times Square, Broadway and the Theater District.Although our stay was perfect we had to wait everytime we had breakfast cause the place is small and many guests came in almost at the same time.

Nice place, kind people, clean rooms no bad smells, clean beds. The room is small but just for the family, remember is right there in Manhattan!Having breakfast is a good point, we didn't wait too long to get a table and have breakfast , people in the cafeteria try to organize the guests very well.The hotel was very close to subway and you can easily go by walking to several places like time square.Very good experience, we will do it for sure.

We loved this hotel as a reasonably priced option with an amazing location in Manhattan. We saved so much time by staying so close to Madison Square Garden, Broadway, Times Square and very close to several subway stations. We would definitely stay there again when we return to NYC.This was our first trip to NYC. The staff was so friendly. Ryan the bellhop was so great to store our bags on check-in and check-out so we could go and tour the city. Breakfast was included as was high speed internet. Why pay more and not get these items included?

The front desk staff was helpful. The room was prepared and ready when I checked in. I especially appreciate the free breakfast with the friendly host, Ayman. He was such pleasant greeter at breakfast.

Appreciated very friendly help & attitude ; Ayman has become a friend & computer instructor. BW is lucky to have such a emplyee It's a delight to meet someone from Alexandria, a place I have wanted to visit for years.

Very exciting vacation. Nice hotel, very friendly personnel which always support where question needs solutions. Service is very good and breakfast is changing every day... it is always good in quality and fresh. The destination is is perfect to teach everything in NYC. For evening the most is in walking distance and if futher it can be done by metro or Uber. We used Uber here and there and paid between 10-15 bugs. For us it was a perfect holiday. I will always recommend this place to my family and friends further.

This was our 3rd stay at the Best Western Herald Square. The hotel is very clean, the staff is great and helpful and I love the free breakfast. Parking is close by and you can get a discount sticker at the front desk. It is also close to Penn Station, the Empire State building, Times Square, Macy's and the stores in Herald Square. The subway is nearby too.

I spent a night in New York on business, and I chose this hotel because it was fairly affordable and had good reviews. I didn't find it immediately because the front is rather small, but the rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend staying here.

We just checked out after staying here for six nights. We arrived earlier than check in and Bebe was so helpful and checked us in early so we could get out and explore the city. This hotel is in such a great location. A couple of blocks from Empire State Building, a nice walk up 5th Ave., a few blocks to Penn Station, close to Broadway for a quick walk up to Times Square and the subway is right around the corner.The hotel is super clean and modern! The hotel has a a nice little bar with happy hour from 4-9 with $4 beer and $6 glasses of wine. Breakfast is a nice addition to the stay here, with a fun selection of pastries from a local bakery.I highly recommend staying here for any trip to NYC. It really is a nice place to stay. The staff were super friendly and always helpful with directions and recommendations.Thanks for everything, we already look forward to coming back for another visit!

This Best Western is located in a very good position to enjoy Manhattan (just walking around). Very close to Port authority bus terminal , very clean, nice lounge bar, nice fitness room ... Be prepared to be a little squeeze during breakfast!

As Diamond Reward members we always try to stay in a BW where we go. We had a short day and a half in New York City before a flight to Morocco. This hotel is in mid-town and close to many interesting sites. We stayed on the top floor with our room overlooking 36th Street. Lovely little room ... only complaint was the fact the Heating/Air Conditioning vent was directly over the bed. We had to turn it off due to blowing on our heads ... then the room got a little cold as it was extremely cold in NYC while we were there. For some reason the shower water sputtered and we never did get a good flow. The breakfast room is on the lower level, was a good size and had a lovely variety of breakfast foods. Hotel staff was very professional and accommodating.The hotel also had a quaint little back patio bar where we enjoyed a cold beverage after a long day of sightseeing. Can't remember the name of the gentlemen that looked after us in the bar but he was very attentive with all the customers. If another visit to New York is in the cards for us we would definitely stay here again as it is very convenient to so many sights within walking distance.

Staff at this hotel were all friendly. It may be small but it makes up for it in Service!! Everyone is so helpful and pleasant. Ahmad at the complimentary breakfast was outstanding. Especially like that they vary the breakfast items every day. Small lounge at back of hotel had drink specials everyday. Hotel was central to everywhere you want to go, subway, Central Park, Times Square, MSG. Etc, etc.

I had visited New York for the first time and I stayed in the Best Western premium herald square hotel I had a wonderful time in the hotel staff there are polite customer service excellent very clean breakfasts perfect specially one of the staff called Ayman I will definitely return there any time I will be in New York thank you for your service

Very clean, prime location, very nice breakfast, Mr Ayman is the best staff we have ever seen in our past holidays; helpful, friendly, with big nice smile and never say no.I highly recommend this hotel.

Great location near Times Square , big stores, Empire State and Broadway when we return back we found the room arranged and Super clean Friendly staff at the restaurant and reception Room has all the needed facilities

Hotel is located Midtown, close to Macy's and to the Empire State Building.Nice room, clean but small. Comfortable bed.Staff at the front desk was always helpful and smiling. If you search for an hotel located in Manhattan with a reasonable price, this is a very good choice.

I got a lot for my money, super affordable, great location, great service, great breakfast. My mom and I enjoy everything from this hotel, the staff is super friendly. Every person that works there is approachable.

This is a great spot I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting NYC. The staff was super friendly especially SHAKLA and Ryan!! They also had the best breakfast in the morning! It does get a little crowded, so get downstairs early :)

Especially in NYC location is everything. Centrally located by Herald square and just north of Times square is a small hotel that maximizes it's space as good as I have ever seen in NYC. Clean, affordable (for NY), typical hotel breakfast (though the eggs were strange), nice little fitness center.Bed comfortable. Only negatives are thin walls and you hear everyone in the halls including the people that get confused and try to open your door at night. Never been to a hotel that gives 2 pairs of earplugs. Even in Manhattan.

The rooms are small, but that's not an issue when you're in New York and able to walk to so many things nearby. The staff went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable with bringing up our luggage, carrying up a mini fridge up for us and allowing a later check out. They provide earplugs to block out city sounds and sounds outside your door.The bartender in the lounge was really friendly and gave great recommendations for restaurants.

Beware when booking. I paid at time of booking for a room for 2 nights. When I arrived at the hotel I was told my card was declined. Apparently they charged my card at time of booking. Then on a later date returned the money to the card and then tried to charge again which was declined ruined my husbands birthday trip.

(I am very late in reviewing this because I always overthink what to say.)Location: Two blocks from Bryant Park. Short 5-10min walk to Times Square. Plenty of places to eat and shop nearby. Close to subway entrances. Overall a great midtown location.Rooms: Yes, they are small. But it’s the city that never sleeps so we didn’t mind. There was enough room for two adults and two teens, our four pieces of luggage, small day backpacks, and bags we accumulated. I didn’t say spacious. But it’s doable. Service: Every was so nice! The front desk gave us a welcome bag since we are signed up for Best Western rewards. Cleanliness: No complaints!Breakfast buffet: It was often crowded but they had to-go containers. The offering was plentiful, even for a picky eater like I am.We would stay here again if visiting NYC. We thought of staying in another borough or even NJ but we wanted to be centrally located. We figured we could get to the other boroughs pretty easily from here, and we were able to make it to a couple.

We’ve just returned from a 5 night stay at the Best Western Premier, this hotel is at a fantastic location. The bedrooms were always kept sparkling clean which was nice to come home to from a long day on the feet. We included breakfast on our stay, again this was great! A selection of lots of different foods. Hot buffet,cereals, bagels, and amazing pasterys. The waiting staff in the breakfast area were second to none. I think the gentlemen’s name was Ayman, he was always smiling and happy to help nothing was too much to ask for! We decided just to sit in the bar on st Patrick’s night as the streets/bars were mental, this was great as it was a relaxed environment and good atmosphere. As always the guy behind the bar was very helpful, we were looking for information on getting to certain tourist attractions and he broke it all down and told us when is the best time to go, everything! Amazing staff at this hotel. Would highly recommend!Until the next time

This hotel seems pretty new and is well maintained. Very clean and service is very good. I check in at 1 am, and i was cordially greeted and checked in to my room. An attendant came and set up a crib for my daughter around 1:30 am and helped us with all our need. I was very impressed. Room and bathroom was very clean. bed was comfortable. Toiletries were provided. Bathroom space was good, however the room was compact. I was in 2 double bed room. I guess this is what you get in a prime Manhattan location :). The free hot breakfast was pretty good. Ayman the attended and host at the breakfast was very cordial and pleasing. I highly recommend this hotel. Moreover you have free coffee (good) and tea selection at the front desk.Lots of restaurant option around this hotel. 5 min walking to Macys at herald square. The rooms are not noise proof. they do provide ear plugs for a comfortable sleep/

I checked a large amount of hotels in NYC area, to stay with my mom and brother for a short vacation. I read a lot of reviews and decided to reserve here... no complaints at all! - Has a wonderful location: you can easily walk to Times Square, Empire State, Public Library, Rockefeller Center... - Close to metro/bus station - Next to 5th avenue - Has a friendly staff - The breakfast is just the regular continental (oatmeal, cereal, eggs, pancakes, bacon, sausages...), the only difference is they slightly change it every day (Thank you for that!!). One day we had spinach omelette instead of scrambled eggs, the other french toast instead of pancakes, the other bacon instead of sausages... very appreciated. The only Cons we had is the Complimentary Drink: event-though we reserved a double room, and we were 3 people, we only got 1 complimentary drink at the bar-lounge they have (I asked why, the reason: hotel policy)... guess what, we didn’t use it. Besides that, it’s a really nice hotel. NOTE: I have read that the rooms are quite small, indeed they are, but since we were only there to get some rest and sleep... it wasn’t a huge concern. Overall, nice experience and I would recommend this hotel to everyone looking for a place to stay in NYC.

Excellent friendly staff! Perfect location for easy access to subways, shopping etc...4 stars due to size of rooms...very small but workable for a first tourist trip to New York. Beds are very comfortable too! Housekeeping starts at 830am so use your door sign if you like to sleep in! Overall a great experience!

Great start to our NYC time. Very convenient location, staff is welcoming,attentive and considerate. We were checked into our room early. Small but clean and all we need. Comfy beds and lovely shower. Shout outs for great service to Bebe, Ryan and Ayman. Cheers to the rest of our stay. Look forward to checking out the Happy Hour deal this afternoon.

The hotel is close to subways, 5th Ave and Time Square theaters. The street itself is quiet. Beds are super comfortable and room is equipped with a coffee maker. Did miss not having a fridge/minibar. Included breakfast is basic, but does offer hot and cold food. Our room with king size bed faced the court area, so was very quiet. The hotel and rooms were very clean, but would encourage improved environmental standards.The staff were great . Front desk - Farrah and Ryan - as well as all other staff were always ready to provide information regarding transportation and sight seeing information. i recommend this hotel and would return there next time in NYC

My friend and I decided to visit New York for our spring break and were very happy to find such good rates at this best western. We chose the hotel for the rate and free breakfast, but when we arrived we were blown away by the service! What a great find. Be sure to join their rewards program. It was free, and they gave us snacks to take out with us. On our last day, they kept our bags for us even after our checkout so we could enjoy the city. The breakfast team was kind and hospitable. The hotel is also very close to main subway stops, and we found it easy to get to any part of the city within 30 minutes or less. 10/10 would recommend.

Thanks to all the staff at BWP we were able to have an enjoyable two night stay in NYC. The room was small, however like my family assured me upon arrival, we weren’t there to hang out in the room all day. The room was clean and they replenished with clean towels and tidied up while we were gone. The continental breakfast offered a large variety of choices.Robert was exceptional.Good proximity to MSG.

Back in December we stayed at this hotel.We returned to our room at 1AM. At approximately 10 AM that morning the “housekeeping manager”, knocked on our door to have the maintenance man change the smoke alarm. As I opened up the door, with my tooth brush in hand, she proceeded to open the door while I am standing right behind it. They barged right in to change out the smoke alarm. The “housekeeping manager” kept the door wide open and kept getting in my way as I was trying to get in and out of the bathroom.Was it imperative to have this done at that moment? It couldn’t have waited until we checked out? I certainly found this very inconvenient and an unpleasant surprise. We paid about $313 for our room, which we had a check out time that we were trying to adhere to. I would think the staff would be more professional, considerate and apologetic for interrupting our morning.There is no excuse for terrible customer service.

We have spent fantastic week in this hotel located in the heart of NYC. The hotel is prepared provide Glute-free bread and cornflakes to the breakfest what is very appreciated by coeliacs. Thanks to positive attitude of hotel employees as Bebe or Aymann was everything really easy and we have enjoyed our vacantion for 100 %!

I'm very pleased to choose Best Western hotel for my staying in New York.The internet is very fast which was my first concern because I'm here for business trip. Entire service is great from all staff, but I have to special thank Ayman who is very kind and giving me a happy breakfast time in cafeteria every morning. I'll definitely come back to this Hotel for next trip. Highly recommend the Best Western Harald Square hotel!

My visit was very pleasant and generally very comfortable. There is noise from the hallway relatively early in the morning, slamming doors etc., so if you are a night owl, don't plan on sleeping in. Other than that, I found everything to be very clean (most important to me), well-appointed, and cozy. My particular room was on the small side, but I was not spending a lot of time in it, so that did not matter to me much. Hotel staff was very accommodating and friendly.

We were excited by the promised features, a feeling that continued upon our arrival and glances at the small but stylishly decorated and comfortable lobby. It promised an intimacy unusual for chain hotels, particularly in NYC. The check-in went smoothly, thanks to Bebe and Jacane. The elevator was immaculate and contemporary, but slow to arrive and, as we ultimately learned, very noisy. The latter two details proved to be the reason we can't recommend the hotel, alas. Our 17th floor room -- and very comfortable king bed -- faced 36th Street, and provided a stirring view of midtown, and the bustle that makes NYC such a fascinating destination. We loved the carpeting and the very stylish look and feel of the room, including the bathroom, as well as the immaculately hallway. But all through the night, and particularly in the morning rush (7a-9a) the nearby elevators clanged so incessantly and loudly we found it hard to sleep soundly and nearly impossible to sleep in. The breakfast room was well-stocked with what one might call standard hotel breakfast items, and Ayman there made sure that items didn't run out. So breakfast was a pleasant experience. That said, we can't overlook the clanging and very slow elevator service, so we suggest staying elsewhere, especially if a good night's sleep is a prerequisite.

I would like to thank the management and staff at the Best Western Harold Square for making my 1st trip to NYC a great one. We got I to the city later then expected, and needed to get changed and to Broadway. The Hotel allowed us an early check-in. Which allowed us to freshin up prior to the show. The rooms were small as described in other reviews, but very clean and comfortable. We enjoyed a great nights sleep and a great breakfast after long days in the city. Thank you again for the fantastic hospitality!

Hotel staff was great and situation was good.Breakfast was typical amerivan breakfast. Only minus on hotel was that we stay at 17th floor and when you turn shower on and hot water on...the water preasure drop...so when take the hot shower you have to very close to wall..rooms were littlebit small but it dosent mather because you went see the the city not the hotel :)we ask for quiet room that we get.Special thanks to Robert he was grate guy.i hope he likes finnish coffey ;)all in all good hotel if were ever come back this is the place we want go.

I could not have been happier! A true gem! From amenities, including hot breakfast, king-size beds, free high-speed wifi, to location and staff, it was a great experience. I especially want to single out Farrah at the bar, who could not have been more helpful and charming (from making sure my restaurant reservations elsewhere were taking care of me and my party to making me feel welcome), Robert at the desk, who was delightful and caring (especially after I had a very late arrival due to bad weather, even providing me with snacks to take to my room), Bebe also at the desk and Ryan, who took care of my bags. I've stayed at dozens of hotels in NYC and this is a hidden gem!

I travel quite a bit and stay at many hotels. This is one of the best. I strongly recommend it. Great service. Free breakfast. The reception staff went out of their way to make sure I was happy with the accommodations.

It´s one of the best hotel I´ve been in NYC. Attendance are amazing. Location is one of the best. Everything is near. It´s very clean. Breakfast is higher than we expected.. Hope to return soon on it.

From check in to check our, the entire staff was fantastic!! Farrah helped at the bar and at the front desk. She and all staff was as helpful as can be. Great location. Near Penn Station, subways, great food and drink. Clean comfortable room.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Room was super cramped but i expect that considering we are staying in the city. Breakfast was good and had a decent selection. I would suggest getting your breakfast early as the lines get long pretty quick. Bar on location is very small but cool. Liked our bartender. she was very accomodating. Our room was clean every day upon our return daily. I would definitely recommend this place and location and i would definitely go back.

Stayed a night here for just about $100 after taxes and fees - quite a good price given the location! Convenient to Penn Station/MSG, Grand Central, Empire State Building and pretty much anywhere in Midtown - Times Square was maybe a 10 minute walk.Stayed on the 3rd floor on a weekday night, and noise wasn't an issue. I could see how it could be noisier on weekends, but the street itself seemed fairly quiet so probably wouldn't be too bad. Earplugs were provided in the room but we didn't need them.Room was a decent size for Manhattan. The breakfast was good. Spotlessly clean. Would stay here again.

Very comfortable room, Sergio at the bar was great. Large assortment of items at breakfast in the morning. I didn’t use the gym but it looked nice. I would say if you’re looking to stay in the Midtown area this is an excellent choice for the money. I would definitely stay again.

Amazing Staff, great room, awesome breakfast. A must if you are looking to stay near herald square (close to Macy's time square and Flatiron district). Great value for your money too. Easy access to subway and busses

I love staying at this hotel when visiting the city due to its location. It's in between Grand Central and Penn Station. The price was great for the time of year too. We had a wonderful view of the Empire State building.

The hotel was half a mile from Penn Station. The room was clean and tidy. Breakfast was terrific. Went to three plays and three museums during our visit. Reastaurants Patsy's and Oceana were wonderful. Will be back.

Portsmouth, Virginia, United States

review_body: This hotel is a little gem. Central for Times Square, Macy’s, Penn Station & Port Authority Bus terminus. Rooms are small as are most in NYC, but they are spotlessly clean. Decor is tasteful & recently done. There is a hotel bar that does happy hour every day 4pm to 9pm. The female bartender (sorry unsure of her name) is efficient & very pleasant indeed & a real asset to Best Western. In previous experiences at other hotels, staff have been brash & unfriendly probably due to being busy but it shouldn’t be taken out on guests. The reception desk staff are ultra gelf too. I will be definitely returning here for future visits to NYC.

Very accommodating staff. We were allowed an early check in and late check out. Great breakfast. The location is not the greatest for being near times square for those who have that in mind. The problem with this hotel is its location near 3 local bars. I was shocked at the noise we constantly heard, including a street fight at 2 am outside of a local Irish bar. I have stayed at hotels on Broadway that were quieter. Not the hotels fault but guests need to be aware of the possibility of noise if you're room faces 36th street. Earplugs are provided. Also no fridge or microwave as the website states but a small refrigerator was provided at no charge.

I love this hotel. I stay here every year. The location is so central to everywhere you might want to go and within walking distance of the subway. There are numerous restaurants both expensive and inexpensive within walking distance. The front desk staff are incredibly helpful and can direct you anywhere you need to go. The rooms are super nice and clean. There are 6 rooms per floor. They can keep your luggage if you arrive early or check out early and want to explore the city. I honestly wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Paid 190$ per night in january 2019 right after new years. Room size was good, or what you can expect, for new york hotel standards. Great location, walking distance to a lot and close to the subway, the Path, Penn station, Grand Central and PABT. 14th floor with views of the Empire State and room facing back/south so no street noice, but earplugs in room is a nice perk. Big shower. Not long waiting time for the elevator, free coffee in the lobby, thank you. Had two double beds which are quite small but works with young children. I always do research before I reserve and this hotel was to my expectation and even more. Nice interior throughout. No wifi problem. Breakfast was actually good for being included but breakfast room is small. One of two mornings we had to wait for a table coming down around 8.30-9. Wait was maybe 5 minutes but staff were doing a great job, especially Ayman (spelling?). Fitness room was ok, you can break a sweat if you want to. Lounge/bar was nice and cosy and Sergio working there is a keeper! Excellent happy hour prices, 4 $ for a bottled beer. If you do your research beforehand you'll probably be satisfied. Best hotel we've stayed at in NYC under 200$ per night.

What a great hotel, the staff are wonderful, everybody smiles, nothing is to much trouble, breakfast is fantastic and sets you up for the day, we cannot recommend this hotel enough, we have stayed in NY on numerous occasions and this hotel is by far the best also for the location.

Perfect location, good breakfast (could be more fruits, vegetables, healthy option), friendly staff, clean rooms. I really like coffee and tea desk for 24\7 in the lobby. Definitely I will stay again and recommend friends.

Stayed here for 4 nights mid jan, asked in advance for a higher floor room and was given room 1305, looking out our window on arrival we were met with the sight of The Empire State Building lit up in all its glory.There was nothing too much trouble for hotel staff, from front desk to staff in the cosy lounge bar, the bar has a happy hour from 4pm till 8 or 9 pm for beer and wine, $4 for 2 bottles of Peroni was a bargain !!Breakfast is offered downstairs, bit of a tight squeeze when busy but staff got us seated as soon as possible, good choices, fresh fruit, juices, hot items, cereals, toast, pastries and yoghurts and coffee and tea.The bedroom was smallish but had everything you may need, tea/coffee maker, iron and board, docking station, charging points for mobiles , bathroom spotless, great shower and again kitted with everything you may require.Already planning our next visit to NY and will not look past this hotel. Thank you.

A hotel in a good touristy location that's clean, comfortable, with pleasant staff. My room at the back was very quiet with a super comfy bed - which is much needed after many hours spent walking the mean streets of NYC.

The price and location are excellent. Easy walking destinations, subway around the corner and several restaurants and nightspots within walking distance. We travelled with nine people. The rooms aren't huge but we made out just fine for our one night stay.

We stayed here for a weekend in the Herald Square area. Our modest sized room had all the amenities needed, nicely decorated and a view of the Empire State bulding. Staff was friendly and helpful. The complimentary hot breakfast was a nice touch. The only caveat is the steady bang noise coming from the elevator shaft, BUT the hotel provided complimentary earplugs for those that would be bothered by this. We were not. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

We (3 adult women) booked this hotel for a weekend trip to NYC to see theater. We choose it because we were able to get two double beds in a single room and for its proximity to the theaters. It definitely delivered on these! The location was super convenient; not only to theater, but for traveling (we took the train to/from Penn Station which was a short 10 minute walk from the hotel). We stayed in room 604 which was facing an alley making it very quiet. There were fresh ear plugs on the night stand when we arrived, but we did not even need them- I never heard much street noise.The room was tight for 3 adults, but we expected this knowing hotels in Manhattan tend to be quite small. Had we been staying more than the weekend, it wouldn't gotten annoying, but for the 2 night stay it was perfectly fine for us.The room was clean. The linens left something to be desired (clearly clean, just not high quality - one of our towels had a hole in it), but again, for the price point, we weren't upset. The shower, however, was great! Fantastic water pressure and hot! This was so nice since we visited during a cold weekend in January (temps in the 20s F) and needed to warm up after spending all day walking around in the cold.Another reason we chose the hotel was for the convenience of having breakfast included. Breakfast was fine - bagels, pastries, eggs, sausage, waffles/pancakes, yogurt, coffee, etc. We opted to skip breakfast the second morning to find something a bit nicer. In retrospect, given all the grab-and-go options in NYC, I probably wouldn't bother with breakfast at the hotel. The lobby had ice water, hot tea, and hot coffee 24/7 - nice bonus.The staff was great - very pleasant and helpful. Ryan stored our bags for us upon arrival (before our room was ready) and after checkout (so we could come back for them before catching our train). I kept forgetting things in my bags and needed to get back to them and Ryan was so nice and patient each time!Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, especially given the low price point compared to other hotels around the city.
