Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Very friendly staff, special note to Ayman and the receptionist for helping us out with some special requests. The bartender in the lounge was very welcoming. The shower pressure on the 17th floor could be better.

This hotel was easy to find. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The breakfast was really nice too to set you up for the day ahead. The barman Sergio is an absolute asset to the hotel. He is so friendly and warming. His advice and knowledge of the city helped us greatly especially telling us the best way to get from the hotel to JFK airport directly. He is truly a nice guy. The hotel is close enough to alot of the sights too. The noise level wasn't a problem either within the room at night knowing how busy and loud the city is.All in all we would definitely recommend and use this hotel again.

The Best Western Premiere has it all--classy, affordable, quiet and the staff is great! They have thought of everything: free coffee and tea in the lobby, easy to get a cab outside, bar open at night, great breakfast downstairs, gym, clean, comfortable room with iron, hair dryer, desk, closet. Very, very comfortable bed-- we heard no noise and did not need the little complimentary ear buds. The staff was very accommodating to me and my friend last night. You can check your bags before check in if you come in early and want to sightsee. I HIGHLY recommend it!

The staff and service is excellent. The location is great, close to Times Square and the Empire State Building, restaurants and bars the rooms are small but clean and comfortable. We were pleased with the breakfast as well; made our day start out easier. In our experience, make sure to go early for breakfast to avoid waiting. it gets crowded early.

Bebe was a charm checking us in. supplied us with maps, info & a goodies bag. We had 2 rooms booked for 3 nights. Rooms were small as expected but very clean, neat and accommodating. Only issue is you can hear everything from the room next door, probably why earplugs are supplied. We had quiet neighbours and with only 6 rooms per floor you would be unlucky to get a noisy one. Breakfast room was small & there was only a line up one of the three mornings I was there. The hotel is close to everything you need but away from the hustle & bustle of NYC.I would recommend this hotel to family & friends.

This was a great hotel experience. The room was VERY quiet and clean, the WiFi was super fast and breakfast was presented well and tasted great. The location is also a plus, close to many sites to see and several restaurants in easy walking distance. I will be staying at this hotel my next visit to NYC.

Both Ayman and Muhid took good care of us during our daily breakfast, clean tabels, hot fresh coffee and every day new things to enjoy. A good start on our daily trips in NY during Christmas 2018. They made our stay even more pleasant.Thank you!!

Frankly, I like Best Western Hotels. This one is my absolute favorite. All of the employees are friendly and helpful. My room was on the 16th floor and I could see the Empire State Building (and the nightly light show). I mentioned that I was there celebrating my birthday. When I returned from a day shopping and sightseeing, there was a lovely birthday gift in my room. Note: the rooms are small but most rooms in NYC are small. However, the bed was very comfortable and the room was satisfactory.

Staff was amazing and Bebe at the front desk was very helpful with any questions about the city and activities. Standard rooms are small for 3 females but we made it work. Breakfast has a great selection. Hotel is centrally located to shopping, subway and many quick stop cafes and restaurants. Not a far walk from Time Square, quick subway to Rockefeller Center.

Located in the heart of the action, clean rooms, excellent staff, a few minutes walk from penn station, radio city music hall, Times Square, Central Park, Broadway shows, shopping, and anything else you could possibly want!

Very good location, accommodations and staff. Room was ready when we arrived to they allowed us to check in early. It was very clean although smaller than we had booked. They offered to correct the next day but it was all good so we stayed in the original room. Breakfast was included and a pleasant surprise. Many offerings, hot and cold, so sure to please everyone. Also received a buy one get one drink card on arrival. After a long next day in NYC went to the bar. Sergio was at the bar and he was great. Quick service, good conversation and a super attitude. Made for a fun evening. Also several restaurants and delis type shops very close. Fortunately they were opened Sunday night.

Loved this hotel, so close to attractions and really friendly staff. Breakfast was great, room a little small but adequate, really clean hotel, we really enjoyed and will return. They kept our cases safe on our last day as were not flying until late afternoon

I had originally booked to stay at a different hotel until I saw some awful reviews and cancelled it. I am so glad I changed my original booking as this hotel is a great little hidden Gem. The room was exactly as it was in the pictures, nicely decorated and clean. It had a great little coffee/tea machine in the room and 24 hr tea, coffee and iced lemon water in reception. The room was a little compact for 3 adults and only one 3 drawer chest and a narrow single door wardrobe, my suggestion would be to do away with the desk in the room and replace it with another chest of drawers and that would solve the need to live out of a suitcase. We were only there for 6 nights so it wasn't really a major problem for us. The breakfast was a real bonus and kept us going throughout the whole day. I would not hesitate to stay here again and would definitely recommend this hotel.

For hotel prices in NYC, the Best Western Premier was a great value for the price. The room was clean and spacious for New York standards, bed was comfortable, wifi worked well, good shower pressure, etc. Hotel is ideally located close to subway and Macy's and an easy walk to Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square. We walked to Central Park as well. Included breakfast was excellent! Many hot items each day as well as the usual fare. Staff was very friendly and bar/lounge was great too, and a very good value for drinks there. Would definitely return and highly recommend if you want a great location at a decent price.

We will stay here again. It was very clean, the bed was super comfy, and the hotel was located close to subway and Time Square. They served breakfast and not any need we had. The room had a window we could open to let a cool breeze in or just hear the NYC sounds. However, when we wanted quite, we had that too .

We stayed here for a few days in mid-Dec. The location, service, quiet/nice rooms is highly recommended! A sincere thank you to Robert, Bebe, housekeeping, luggage storage folks, and breakfast crew! Awesome job folks!!!! We will definitely be back!

Our stay was really great! The hotel is very clean and comfortable. It is really close to a lot of attractions. The breakfast is tasty. I would like to say thanks to Robert the night clerk at the hotel. He was really helpful and nice to talk to.

This hotel is a go to favorite due to the attentive employees, location, and overall appearance and breakfasts. The breakfast staff works hard and the food is good and plentiful. Shameza, Bebe and Raffat, Daniel and Debbie are personable and make our stays pleasant.

The hotel is ideally situated in a perfect location the rooms are perfect for anyone wanting to explore the city, it was my first time and I wasn't disappointed the staff are brilliant and the breakfast crew were just as nice

Great location,very close to Bryant Park! Very helpful and friendly staff! I love the view from my room! The bed was very comfortable and I even notice the craziness of the city when I was there! I totally recommend!

Our family was in NY on vacation, and stayed here. We used the complimentary breakfast at the hotel. This being a Premier Best Western, they have table service and Ayman did a superb job of getting us a table cleared quickly, and pre busing our table as we emptied plates and glasses. Ayman, was attentive and professional.

This was a great location for our five days in New York. It was central, near Times Square, Macy's and the underground system. The hotel seemed to be newly renovated - clean with modern decor. We had a small room at the back of the hotel which was quiet but there were two comfortable double beds and a good ensuite shower. The staff were helpful and friendly and it was wonderful to get back to a cleaned replenished room after a day's sightseeing. Breakfast was fantastic. I looked forward to it every morning! Large choice with freshly cooked food choices. Go early as it gets busy! I recommend this for a short stay in this fantastic city.

Stayed here for five nights and were very happy with our choice. From the exterior it does not look the most inviting but once inside it was a different story. We arrived mid afternoon in the dark and the snow to be met by very welcoming staff at reception. Our room was on the sixth floor and it was very cosy and spotlessly clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom had a good walk in shower and lots of toiletries were provided. Our room was at the back of the hotel and was very quiet. Also discovered that we could see a glimpse of the Empire State Building. Breakfast was served in the cellar and it also was very good with lots of choices available. The room was quite small but the staff were very efficient at clearing tables and keeping things moving.The location of this hotel is excellent and there are so many things to see within walking distance. The subway is also just round the corner and Penn Station is about ten minutes walk away. We ate in Trademark restaurant which is right beside the hotel a couple of times and it was very good and had a nice atmosphere.This was our first time in New York and this hotel added to the overall enjoyment of our holiday. Thank you also to Bebe at reception and the other staff for answering all our various queries with such a pleasant attitude.

Stayed here for 2 nights as I particularly like the location . We usually stay in the soleil which is very close . The price I paid was fantastic and I was worried that it would be awful . How wrong I was .. check in was speedy and our room was ready at midday and so we were able to freshen up and hit the streets . The room was small but bigger than others I’ve stayed at . We were 704 which had no view but 2 very comfortable beds a small hanging robe, tv and a very nice modern walk in shower . We also had coffee tea etc .The lobby had coffee going all day and a very welcome ice cold water fountain .The hotel offered breakfast which is something I’d not experienced in NYC before and I had no expectations other than I thought it would be very basic . Again I was wrong it was excellent and Axman who was on duty was great !!!!Hot and cold choices and it was fresh and plentiful .. set us up for the day .I would definately reccomend this hotel and I will return one day . We had a fabulous time .. Thankyou to Bebe and all the staff on front desk you made us feel so welcome !!!

I booked this room with no research other then Best Westerns are pretty reliable. My every expectation was exceeded. Great employees, clean, modern, EXCELLENT BREAKFAST!!I will definately book a room here again.

Just spent the A-few days there at Thanksgiving! Reasonably priced. Location is close to Penn Station. The staff was professional and friendly. They were top notch all the way around. The room was well appointed, comfortable and spotless. Breakfast was excellent! Will now make this my go to place in NYC!

Very good central location, room is comfortable and although tight on storage, really not too in size bad for the middle of New York. Shower is spacious and nice. Breakfast can get busy and hectic later on, but provides a reasonable selection and saves buying breakfast out.

We stayed at this hotel for one night and we were very impressed. It's less than 10 minutes from Penn Station, and it was an easy walk - even with 2 large suitcases. The room is basic, and small, but it's clean. The free breakfast in the morning was what made me give this hotel 5 stars - it's amazing. The service is spectacular (especially Ayman, who greets everyone at the door, and makes you forget that you are eating at a hotel buffet, rather than a restaurant!), and the food was hot, very tasty and there's a huge selection to choose from. The baked goods, breads and bagels are so good, and fresh that I wonder if the hotel brings them in from a local bakery. Don't hesitate to book this hotel!

this is the 3rd time we have been therefriendly and very clean the desk new us when we came in and after dinner at Keens a few doors away when we returned we were met with bottles of water and a friendly" Good Night sleep well"

We stayed 4 nights and had the luck to have a room overlooking the Empire State Building, on the 17th floor. We loved our room and were absolutely delighted with the absolute silence of the room itself.

Great location, close to plenty of restaurants and accessible to subway station. Walking distance to Javits Center. Although the lobby is a bit dated, the rooms are very comfortable. The staff is very friendly and quick to offer dining recommendations. Nice clean linens, firm mattress and great water pressure. There are plenty of breakfast options for everyone.

Location is great, within walking distance of Penn Station, Broadway and other attractions. The hotel seemed to be recently remodeled. The rooms were quiet, beds comfortable and breakfast had good choices. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Excellent staff they were so Helpful for any questions we had for areas and subways to get around New York . We had an awesome time this hotel is close to time square , lots of restaurants , shopping and just a few blocks away from the Empire State building . Beds were great slept very good every night.

We recently stayed at the Best Westerna nd enjoyed the stay. The rooms on the front may be noisy as they are closest to the street. The rooms are similar to many in New York (small).This is a small hotel but the staff was very courteous and accommodating. Close proximity to Macy's and the subway. Breakfast was included which made it easy each day before venturing out.

We stayed here in September 2018. The room was very clean, the staff were very helpful and we had a great stay. The free breakfast was great, there was plenty of food and choice. We did not struggle once to get food. It was constantly replenished. They have the option of a free refrigerator upon request, they have limited numbers so it can not be guaranteed. We had one for 7 of the 10 days that we stayed. The biggest down side is, the rooms are quite small (as you come to expect in NY) so the addition of this in the room did limit space. We would stay here again!

This hotel is located just a few blocks from Penn Station and the myriad of transit options. In the opposite direction you will find the 6 line. Within a few blocks walking, you can get anywhere in NYC. This is also on the same street as a lot of pubs which aren't anything special but great options for a beer close by. The hotel itself is typical NYC. The rooms are small, the bathroom is small, the lobby is even small. We were on the 6th and facing 36th Street. We could definitely hear the road, but it wasn't an issue for us. For the price, you're getting typical NYC. The rooms are clean, the service was friendly, but the location sold me.

In March 2018 for the firts time we booked this hotel for our International Experience with our executive students in our Masterdegree Program(Personal Leadership in Innovation & Change). Staff was really nice and helpfull, location is fabulous en breakfast really good.Hope to be back with our students in March 2020 :-)

Expensive. Probably the smallest hotel/motel room I've ever been in in my entire life. I've visited restrooms that were bigger. We paid for location, location, location, right in the heart of mid-town. Allow plenty of time for breakfast. Area very small for a hotel of this size. The room got very crowded , very quickly. The breakfast itself was very tasty and well presented

This place was great. Location is superb. Breakfast super nice and had everything I needed. Would stay here again for sure. The staff is kind and the room was confortable. Really can't say it better..

We choose the BW Herald Square for its proximity (we walked over with luggage) to our arrival at Penn Station, but then the advantages just kept accruing. Ideally situated, exceptionally clean, nicest folks you could meet, fabulous happy hour, renovated and modern, views from our all-glass outer wall and more. A special shout-out to the front desk folks Shameza, Rachel and Bebe who took care of every one of little requests and to the bartender whose name we don't have. Note too this hotel is exactly one mile from the closest access point to the High Line, which was our principal NYC bucket list item and just fantastic. We were also completely captivated by the intricate architectural features on the older building directly across the street, especially the eagles.

We have been here in this B.W. for the second time ( 2017 and 2018) and that is because of the location in central N.Y. And because of the quality of this B.W. Premier. When we arrived after a long fligt on oktober 19 there was a warm welcome from the reception and we noticed that our whishes about the two rooms were full filled by Bebe Kahn(reception and reservations) The hotel was , as last year, perfect, clean and quiet and that in the middle of N.Y. The dining room and breakfast were absolutely perfect. Our compliments to Muhid he was our attendant, for his advise and services. In short, when you had to plan a stay and visit in N.Y. we can recommend the B.W. Premier Herald Square.

Guus F
Loon op Zand, The Netherlands

review_body: Excellent stay. Very pleasant and professional staff. Our room was beyond our expectations as our window looked right out on the Empire State Building. Convenient to Times Square and Central Park. Nice breakfast included. Thank you.

We stayed here for our family holiday in NYC. We had 6 nights booked and we would highly recommend staying here if you want to be close to the main attractions, with easy access to the transportation links. We were given a warm welcome when we arrived at around 10pm and the reception staff were keen to help and offer any advice on things around us. We had a twin double room (2 adults and 2 children) and although “a little snug”, it was perfectly adequate for the four of us. The room was clean and kept to a high standard, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom had a nice shower. The breakfast each day was really good, with a great selection of fruit, cereals, hot food, toast/bagels and pastries available, along with coffee, tea, fresh juices and water. Shukla and her colleagues provided a great service and always greeted us with a smile each morning. We would certainly recommend this hotel and will definitely book to stay here again for our next family trip to New York.

Perfect location on 36th street, close to a number of good bars and restaurants. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Steve the barman was always very friendly and happy to greet you and remembered your favourite tipple, good choice of bottled beers and a very nice New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc. Good selection at breakfast. Bedroom window had a very close view of the Empire State Building, Close to Times Square, Rockerfeller Centre, Grand Central Station, Macys. Rooms very clean and well maintained. Comfy bed and even comfier pillows. We were only there for 5 nights, the wardrobe was adequate but if you were staying longer it may be a bit small for 2 people.We dined at Frankie and Johnnies on 37th St and was excellent, not cheap. though I would definately recommend this hotel ...... Well Done Thanks for a great stay - Anne & Wayne from Preston , England

This was a great find for us, staying pretty much in the middle of where you want to be as a tourist but just slightly off the major roads. Hotel is fairly small compared to those around it but the rooms are as expected for a big city. Don't let that put you off, we've stayed in much smaller in NYC before. They're well equipped with TV and fast free internet, breakfast is good and changes slightly everyday. 24hr free tea and coffee in the foyer.On our arrival reception staff were efficient and helpful processing our stay in under 5 minutes and giving us some local info etc.... Exactly what you need after a long flight. We would stay here again!

This is a Premier Best Western, meaning it offers great amenities and free hot breakfast. The rates were reasonable for NYC (as long as you book early, you can save up to $100 a night). The only thing lacking was either a hot tub or a bathtub so I could soak my feet from all the walking in NYC.

We chose this hotel following reviews on Trip Advisor. We have to say it was the most wonderful experience. I emailed through to the hotel to explain we were coming to NYC to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary, for which we were given room 1706 with the most fantastic view of the Empire State Building. The room was a good size, the staff very friendly and helpful, the location perfect and the breakfast set us up for the day. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay a memorable one!

The staff-Awesome! One lady helped get us tickets and info to the Statue of Liberty, ferry info, and other info like the subway. Steve, the bartender was cool. The other bartender, big dude with another job on 44th told us about places to eat and chatted it up with us. Our first staff member gave us a room early to put our luggage away since we are platinum members and the lobby was decorated in Halloween decor. Cute! The location to me was perfect. We were close to two different subways lines, direct to downtown, Central Park, Times Square and restaurants.

Miriam C
San Diego, United States

review_body: 2nd time we visited this hotel. On walking distance from metro and a lot more to see. Very friendly, clean and nice rooms. Good breakfast and also for kids to recommand. And some off the staff are exceptional! So Muhid ( and your collegues). Thanks for a great time

Loved the location, clean rooms, quiet, nice staff, great views, free breakfast! Luggage storage available, free coffee/ tea/ water anytime, quick elevators. Nicely decorated rooms and lobby. Thanks for a great stay!

Small hotel in a great spot. Very clean rooms. Friendly staff. Close to the busy Herald Square, where it is easy to get reasonably prices meals, etc. Breakfast included. People mainly stay here form Broadway shows I think, but okay for business too.

I visited NYC with my fiancé and parents this time last year, and we stayed at the Best Western Premier Herald Square. We couldn’t have made a better choice. It’s in a great location, close to Times Square and the Empire State Building. We all slept comfortably, very clean rooms and comfortable beds. They have continental breakfast each morning, which was delicious. They have a bar with patio area, which we enjoyed during the evenings. The staff were all super-friendly. Ryan was very helpful. Being located in Midtown, this hotel was close to so many tourist attractions without feeling like you were located right next to the really busy areas. When we return, this is definitely where we will be staying.

Nice Hotel with excellent location and courteous staff. Rooms are of decent size as per Manhattan standards. Morning Breakfast was part of package and had good options to choose from. Recommended for people looking for value of money.

We loved our stay at this hotel. It’s true that rooms are pretty small but they’re clean, quiet and really comfortable and the location is fantastic. Subway connections and buses are just a few minutes away and the Empire State is around the corner.Breakfast was great, although the room is pretty small and gets very busy, especially at weekends so I’d definitely advise going very early or late. There’s a good range of things to choose from and the selection of hot food changes each day which is nice. Shukla was especially nice and helpful during our stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

I have not known Best Western brand hotels to be great but I was pleasantly surprised at BW Herald Square. The location was great and check in was easy and the front desk person was very pleasant. While my room was a little small (typical for many boutique sized hotels in NYC) there was room for my luggage and a comfy desk. The room was modern with a comfortable bed and the bathroom was updated. Wifi was strong as well. I laughed when I saw ear plugs on my night stand, thinking I would have to use them to deal with outside noises but the room was quiet. The free breakfast was good quality and had a lot of options. While I did not use the fitness center, it looked well equipped. I would definitely come back.

Ideally located to access central attractions and within 2 blocks of subway.Entrance is a little tricky to spot as tucked away off sidewalk.Clean comfortable rooms. Very friendly helpful staff.Would have given 5 rating, but wardrobe storage is very limited. OK if only stopping a couple of nights, but we were on a 3 week tour so had to live out of suitcases

The hotel is great. The location is central and close to all major attractions, bars, restaurants and the metro and train station. The rooms are a good size and very clean and there is a decent bar with outdoor area at the rear.Breakfast was very good and included within the price.The staff are very friendly, especially the bar manager.

My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights while in New York City. The location was amazing, walking distance to nearly everything we wanted to go to. We stayed at the other end of the city for the other two nights we were there as it was closer to some other attractions we wanted to visit. The room was fairly small, but we were not spending much time here so it was not a big deal. There was a small bar that had some good deals if you wanted to grab a quick drink before heading out. The main downfall was that the front desk called us about 5 times throughout our stay asking about payment, when they explained to me the first day I could pay cash when we checked out. I was feeling really sick and finally fell asleep around 9:45 PM one night and the front desk called our room at 10 PM. We were very disappointed they called so late and spoke to the front desk at checkout. We were told the manager would call us that day and we never heard from them. Besides this mishap, I would go back to this hotel merely for the great location.

Location is central and within easy walking distance to major attractions and Broadway shows! Clean (small) rooms, friendly and cordial staff and very good breakfast offerings. Very comfortable rooms (no view but we were out all day anyway) however, would of liked a fridge in our room. Quaint bar at the rear (main floor) which is convenient after a long day touring with happy hour. One of our best experiences at a BW location. Overall a great stay, thank you BW and New York!

Just did four nights in this hotel with my wife. Ideal location, ten minute walk to Times Square, Penn Station or Empire State Building. Very friendly and supportive staff. The breakfasts here are to die for: every day was a different menu and done to a very good standard. Hot and cold drinks available in the lobby 24 hours and a nice little bar to go and relax away from the Manhattan insanity. Adequate but small gym but does the trick. All good points. However this is Manhattan and getting comfortable rooms at a reasonable price in mid-Town is impossible. The standard room here is small - forget about swinging the proverbial cat. We had a king size bed that worked width wise but my feet were often dangling over the side of the bed! But again this is Manhattan and it’s all about location, locatioon, location. All in all this is terrific value for the mid range traveller who is either by themself or with a partner. All in all, a thumbs up from me.

The location is perfect for everything, close to Macy's and Time Square, easy walk to all tourist places. Rooms are comfortable, huge beds. Breakfast was great, all sorts of choice and just perfect to start the day. Would highly recommend

Our group stayed here for four nights and five days. The staff were all friendly, helpful and genuine. The hospitality was real, not put on. The breakfast buffet was full of both hot and cold choices, homemade and varied from day to day. While the rooms were small the beds were very comfortable. The Mid-town location was perfect for both catching the metro about a block and a half away or walking. The daily happy hour was also excellent and very affordable. Better than in our home town in the Midwest. There are lots of little restaurants, sourvenir shops within blocks. The deli type place next door was also a gem.

My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights to celebrate my birthday and our anniversary. The room was small like most NYC rooms but appointed nicely and the housekeeping service did a nice job. Although the breakfast area was a little cramped, it was presented nicely and we were taken care of well when we had breakfast each morning. Ayman was always there to great us with a smile and a "good morning". He kept a watchful eye on everything and even came to help when my pepper shaker got stuck in the holder! We will definitely stay here again when we return for our spring visit.

We were a great location for the subway access, Time Square, Broadway, Empire State Building, etc. The staff were super friendly and helpful. Every time we in the elevator, at the breakfast, or lobby - if we were near 'any staff' - we would smile and ask how was our stay and if they could do anything for us. The breakfast changed everyday and was excellent. We were very pleased with the food. Ayman was so kind and helpful.The room was small but the bathroom was excellent. The bed was comfortable, pillows great.

My mom and I traveled to NYC for the first time. I scoured hotels to stay at while we were going to be in the city. We couldn't have found a better hotel. The staff, the facility, the breakfast, the beds were all great! The hotel is close to many major attractions but far enough away that you didn't hear much noise. We didn't have a room with a great view, but we were only in our rooms to sleep and rejuvenate for our next day of sight seeing. Close to the subway stations, Times Square, Empire State Building, Macys, and the Theatre district. I would definitely stay here again if given a choice.

The rooms at this hotel are what we expected for New York small but yet clean and comfortable. It is close walking distance to many places including Time Square.The staff are very friendly and helpful but the huge plus for this hotel was the complimentary breakfast. All though it was busy most mornings the staff kept the area clean and well stocked with a huge variety to choose from. The quality was also good.Having the breakfast included at the hotel made the morning a lot more manageable traveling with young children.My only negative was I noticed some towels and linen needed to be replaced as they were showing excessive wear with holes in bathroom towels.

We are from Louisiana and went to New York to see the sights. When we arrived in the city we were afraid that all of the stuff you see on TV was the way it was. We were greeted by friendly staff that helped to waylay our worries. The staff was very helpf ull and gave us great help and directions. We will definitely stay their again.

The Best Western Hearld Square was one of the finest hotels. Their customer service is superior. Rachael and Robert provided customer service that sets this hotel abover the rest. The breakfast was great. The rooms were great. Location was great. I can find no fault or criticism.

We are a family of 4 and booked the Best Western Herald for the final night of our 2 week American road trip via booking.com. Having just arrived back in NYC from Washington DC we discovered that the hotel had cancelled our booking citing ‘invalid credit card’. When we contacted the hotel we were initially told they had no details of my booking and was placed on hold long enough for me to learn the words to their terrible music! Subsequently I rang back to be told that I did have a booking and that my card was declined therefore it had been cancelled. When I attempted to rebook directly I was informed that they had no availability... strange that as I had thought I had a room a few moments earlier. Booking.com could not help as the payment is handled by the hotel. When I checked my credit card not only had they taken the payment for the room they cancelled, my partner received a notification from his bank that they had attempted to take a payment from his card without any authorisation. Luckily this was declined. I am now waiting patiently for my refund. Luckily we were able to find an alternative at a reasonable price. Based on our experience I would not recommend this hotel to fellow travellers and be wary that hotel bookings don’t necessarily guarantee you a room. We strongly recommend that you keep a close eye on your emails to avoid this happening to you!

Kingsize room was shockingly small - I have no idea how 2 people would be able to share that room without stumbling over each other and everything, but for one person, it’s okay. Clean hotel, friendly and attentive staff and a great breakfast variety. Great centrally located hotel with access to many amenities whether you want to walk, bus or subway.

This is my first stay at this Best Western hotel and I am happy to say that it's been an awesome one.I had a room with a view of the entrance and it was ok, but then I found out they have rooms with a view to Empire State building and I made a request for that and it was actioned next morning, very happy with this!!Pros:- Friendly staff- Good breakfast.- make sure to come nice and early because the breakfast area is small and there are queues near to the end of the breakfast time i.e. 9:30am. It starts at 6:30am.Things to note:- Rooms are smaller size than other Best Western units around US- If you're taller than 6 feet 2 inches then your feet might go out of the mattress. The mattresses are 6 feet 1 inch or 1.5 I think- Wallpaper in rooms need changing to make it brighter- Walls and doors allow a bit of noise to pass through, so if someone talks loudly in the next room then you might hear it

I have been trying to find a reasonable place to stay in Manhattan that was in close proximity to Times Square and the Theater District. The Best Western Herald Square far surpassed my expectations. Upon arrival, I was greeted warmly by the front desk crew, who were terrific helpers. The morning breakfast was equivalent to any 5-star hotel, with an incredibly professional staff. All this and at worst a 16 minute walk to the theaters and Times Square!! By the way, Macy's is just around the block. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget that is still looking for a little class in their New York City stay.

We have just arrived back from a family holiday to New York and stayed in two rooms in this hotel for 5 nights. The staff were so friendly and always happy to help this includes front of house, housekeeping and breakfast room staff - so everyone really! Our rooms were on the 14th floor and were compact, clean, quiet and had everything you needed for a comfortable stay. Breakfast was plentiful with a variety of foods on offer over the 5 days.You cannot beat the location of this hotel with many attractions within walking distance and subways close by. I would not hesitate to recommend The Best Western Premier Herald Square and will certainly be staying here again!

A clean hotel with an excellent location, within a walking distance from famous sights such as Empire State building. Friendly staff, especially Robert from reception always greeted us with a smile. Breakfast with a lot of different options. We stayed for five nights and the breakfast even changed a little every morning.

This amazing hotel is right beside Empire State building. The rooms are small but comfortable. The staffs Robert, AL were great and the stay is relaxing. I would most likely choose this hotel again!!!!

We just came back from New York city. We went to there 3 days for a family vacation and stayed in this hotel for two nights. Overall it was a very pleasant experience. The hotel is located at the heart of Manhattan and this makes it very easy to get around. In addition the hotel has a nice wifi and a free breakfast. Most importantly, the staff was extremely nice and helpful. Whenever we asked them for anything, they were very kind and enthusiastic. I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a very good yet also a relatively cheap hotel.

This hotel is situated in a great location central to sights and transport links. We spent 3 nights here during the week. The room, although smallish was clean and quiet and the shower was a walk in type, which was welcoming after having many over bath ones in Greece. Breakfast was great with a good selection. We would definitely return to this hotel!

My hubby and I stayed here On a Wednesday and Thursday night. We were in a room in the back of the hotel and never heard a peep from anything outside… No sirens, no traffic, no nothing did we hear. Our view was of another building, but we prefer quiet over a view. Our room was very small, but as they say, this is New York City so that is the norm and it was fine with us. It was very clean and had all the amenities that we needed such as coffee and very nice toiletries. Breakfast each morning was very good and just added to the overall enjoyment of the hotel. There is a lounge area in the back of the hotel, the drinks are reasonably priced and you can sit outside if you want to. Every staff member that we encountered were very courteous. I would highly recommend this hotel as a very nice hotel to stay in and the best bang for your buck considering all of the amenities in the room and the breakfast each morning. If you want a room with a view, you would need to get a room in the front but it will be noisy. If you want a quiet room, get a room in the back . We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to New York City.

This an amazing hotel and i deffinetley reccomend staying there the pool and workout room out very nice. Henry and steven were very nice and if u can find them u should deffinetley talk to them. The pool is 4’6 all around and the workout room is full or olymticals and has one bench. The rooms were very nice and had an amazing tv i would 100%recommend this hotel

West New York, New Jersey

review_body: Had an amazing time with my friends. The bartender was absolutely outstanding! Very attentive and skilled. Felt like family...could've stayed all night!I will be back for sure! Ask for Stephen next time you go!

Great hotel the staff are all caring and nice, the rooms are very nice. I cant complain about this hotel at all. The WIFI, fitness center and breakfast are all top notch as well. It is in a great location as well.

Clean, update hotel. Comfortable beds, friendly staff and good amenities. I've been staying here for the past year and keep coming back because of the staff, comfort and location of the hotel. Close to all my meetings. Best, hands down!
